title: Wolf Blass Red Label Cabernet Merlot
raw_ec_shortdesc: Founder Wolfgang Blass has been making wine in South Australia since 1966. This approachable red is bursting with aromas and flavours of ripe cassis, plum, oak, chocolate and fresh mint. It's full-bodied and smooth with a long, velvety finish. Serve with grilled lamb chops alongside cheesy scalloped potatoes.

raw_ec_shortdesc: Animus is a classic Portuguese red made from indigenous varieties grown in the prestigious Douro Valley. Enjoy it with roasted red meats, poultry or pizza.

title: Wakefield Jaraman Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Garnet color. Aromas and flavors of black cherry, mint, cocoa nibs, and brisket burnt ends with a velvety, lively, dry medium-to-full body and a tingling, delightful, medium-long finish imparting notes of cherry, blackberry, eucalyptus, and black tea with chewy, well-integrated tannins and light oak flavor. Lovely, absolutely lovely; a BTG or stocked up at home, this is a wonderful everyday drinker. Exceptional.  Score - 93. (tastings.com, Aug. 9, 2024)

title: Vaucher Père & Fils Fleurie 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is an attractive version of Fleurie, one of the top-rated of the Beaujolais crus. The nose is very expressive and aromatic, while the palate is full of dark fruit, with some spicy top notes for good measure. The acidity is assertive, and well aligned with the fruit. This lovely wine is very dry, even verging on astringent, and it calls for food, rather than to be drunk on its own. Drink now to 2029.  Score - 93. (Rod Phillips, April 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This is an attractive version of Fleurie, one of the top-rated of the Beaujolais crus. title: Villa Puccini Toscana IGT Governo Toscano
raw_ec_shortdesc: This blend of Sangiovese, Ciliegiolo and Cabernet Sauvignon grapes is vinified using the Governo method. title: Trius Merlot VQA
raw_ec_shortdesc: With a deft touch, Merlot can do quite well in the Niagara region. Trius Winery brings its decades of experience to bear with this ripe, fruit-forward Merlot. Aromas of plum, black cherry and baking spice waft from the nose, while the palate holds rich flavours of blackberry, blueberry, mineral and spice.

title: Tenuta San Guido Le Difese 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2022 Le Difese is plump, juicy and expressive, all of which make it a fine choice for drinking now and over the next handful of years. Crushed flowers, succulent red cherry fruit, mint, spice and blood orange all race across the palate. This exuberant yet mid-weight coastal Tuscan red is a total pleasure bomb. The 2022 is an especially fine edition. It benefits from a warm year - which can be a positive for entry-level wines - earlier bottling and selection. Le Difese is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (both estate and non-estate sites) and Sangiovese, all purchased. Drinking window: 2024-2032. Score - 92. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Feb. 13, 2024)

title: Shanahans The Old Dog Shiraz 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sourced from northwestern Barossa Valley vineyards, this classically styled Aussie Shiraz is big, bold and delightfully complex. Ripe blackberry, chocolate, licorice and plum are joined by mellow oak notes from 12 months in barrel. The producer suggests decanting this and allowing it to breathe if drinking early (prior to 2027), as their minimal fining and filtration techniques can mean sediment may be present. Enjoy through 2032.

title: Tommasi Rafaèl Valpolicella Classico Superiore 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A solid expression of Ripasso with no shortage of oak tannins. Notes of camphor, forest floor, dark fruit, menthol, aniseed and spruce. The mid-palate packs plenty of flavor and yet there is an undeniable freshness that confers lift, energy and impressive length. This wine is barely mid-weighted, and yet the intensity of flavor suggests something with more body. Welcome astringency in the finish. Good drinking. Drink or hold. Score - 90. (jamessuckling.com, April 3, 2024)

title: San Pedro 1865 Selected Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: [Limited-edition Year of the Snake bottling.] San Pedro produces no fewer than a million liters of this red, an ocean literally made of cabernet sauvignon from the Alto Jahuel zone, along with 40% Linderos, all in the Maipo Valley. And the result is delicious - a cabernet with a great deal of varietal presence, very focused on the herbal notes and ripe red fruit. title: Quinta do Vallado Sousão 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2020 Sousão was aged for 16 months in 15% new French barriques and comes in at 14.3% alcohol. Often my sentimental favorite of their reds, this typically shows off the good acidity, red fruits and velvety texture. As the oak impact has declined (in the distant past it could be as high as 80% new), it shows the red fruits better and has lost that creamy texture it once had. Refined, persistent and flavorful, this is very fine again, if not quite as impressive as last year's. It's hard not to admire its finesse and flavor, though, a great combination. Drink date: 2022-2040. Score - 93. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, July 29, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2020 Sousão was aged for 16 months in 15% new French barriques and comes in at 14.3% alcohol. title: Gabriel Meffre St Vincent Cotes Du Rhone

title: San Felice Chianti Classico
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine includes some Pugnitello: an ancient Tuscan grape that was nearly extinct when San Felice began working with it in the late 1980s. Harmonious and long, it's ideal for charcuterie, roast turkey or grilled beef.

title: San Pedro 1865 Selected Vineyards Carmenère 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The nose is recognizably carmenere, with herbal notes that add a layer of freshness, behind that, aromas of ripe red fruit and some spices. The palate is brimming with fruit flavors, and this time the herbs are very subtle, like background music. The tannins are smooth and polished and there are light mineral touches towards the finish on the palate. This carmenere is an excellent example of the variety and comes from the Lolol zone, in the western Colchagua Valley. It was aged for a year in barrels. Score - 93. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The nose is recognizably carmenere, with herbal notes that add a layer of freshness, behind that, aromas of ripe red fruit and some spices. The palate is brimming with fruit flavors, and this time the herbs are very subtle, like background music. The tannins are smooth and polished and there are light mineral touches towards the finish on the palate. This carmenere is an excellent example of the variety and comes from the Lolol zone, in the western Colchagua Valley. It was aged for a year in barrels. Score - 93. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)

title: Rendola Rosso Toscano
raw_ec_shortdesc: Rendola Rosso is a blended wine made of select Tuscan grapes designed to offer classic regional flavours at an excellent value. Alluring candied fruit, cherry, plum, vanilla, and toast aromas replay on an exceptionally smooth palate. Rendola Rosso's ripe tannins would pair well with braised meat dishes or hearty pasta.

title: Quatro Ventos Douro
raw_ec_shortdesc: This fresh, fruity red is produced using Tinta Barocca, Tinta Roriz, and Touriga Franca. The aromatic nose leads you with floral and fruity notes of cherry, raspberry and dark plums. The palate is dry and well-rounded, with ripe blackberry, plums, spice, and toasty notes. Enjoy it with grilled meats, pizza and pasta dishes.

raw_ec_shortdesc: A really focused and rounded Brunello with lovely velvety tannins that give this length and grandeur. It's medium- to full-bodied with a lovely intensity and texture. title: Schroeder Saurus Select Cabernet Sauvignon/Cabernet Franc 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc from San Patricio del Chañar in Northern Patagonia, the 2021 Cabernet-Cabernet Saurus Select aged 12 months in French and American oak. Notes of candied black fruit, marmalade and cassis unfurl over a toasty, ashen layer of oak. Dry and rich on the palate, well-calibrated acidity provides lift to the fine-grained tannins, leading to a flavorful mouthfeel. This tasty Patagonian red lingers on its fruit notes. Drinking window: 2023-2031. Score - 91. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, Feb. 20, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc from San Patricio del Chañar in Northern Patagonia, the 2021 Cabernet-Cabernet Saurus Select aged 12 months in French and American oak. Notes of candied black fruit, marmalade and cassis unfurl over a toasty, ashen layer of oak. Dry and rich on the palate, well-calibrated acidity provides lift to the fine-grained tannins, leading to a flavorful mouthfeel. This tasty Patagonian red lingers on its fruit notes. title: Monasterio de las Viñas Reserva 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Always a killer value, Monasterio's 2019 Reserva, a blend of garnacha, tempranillo, cariñena and cabernet sauvignon, delivers marvellous complexity in the price category, a savoury, sultry, herbal-spicy, dark-fruited red with impeccable balance and very good length, not to mention genuine substance and depth. Remarkable how this company can do this year in and out at the price. Drink or hold until the end of the decade. Tasted July 2024. Score - 90. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Always a killer value, Monasterio's 2019 Reserva, a blend of garnacha, tempranillo, cariñena and cabernet sauvignon, delivers marvellous complexity in the price category, a savoury, sultry, herbal-spicy, dark-fruited red with impeccable balance and very good length, not to mention genuine substance and depth. title: Sensi Chianti Dalcampo DOCG
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Sensi family has been making wines in Tuscany since the late 1800s. The vineyards underwent revitalization and modernization in the 1990s, leading to the wine bottled today. title: Moillard Beaujolais
raw_ec_shortdesc: This fresh Beaujolais is bursting with aromas and flavours of strawberry and raspberry fruit. Juicy and refreshing red fruit on the palate with smooth, balanced flavours. This light and easy red is ideal paired with classic French charcuterie or served with poultry, ham or salmon dishes.

title: Matilda Nieves Mencía 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: 85% Mencia, 8% Garnacha, 7% Sousón. Anyone who has ever seen photographs of the steep slopes of Ribeira Sacra will wonder how it is possible to produce a wine like this in our Value category - but here it is, dark, fresh and thrillingly aromatic from first sniff to last swallow. This limpid, unoaked wine is made from the Mencia grape variety (known as Jaen in Portugal) plus a little Garnacha and Souson, and the emphasis is on its sloe, bramble and damson fruits in all their primary glory, almost as if it had been run from the vats just a week or two earlier. The palate is soft-textured, mouth-filling, exuberant and comely, structured more prominently by acidity than tannin, though that acidity is sweet and juicy in its own right. There is nothing at all sharp or hard about this tender, almost lip-smacking red... yet the variety itself, and the legacy of its austere, granite-soiled origins, somehow contrive to stop the wine tasting simple. Platinum. Best in Show. Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2021)

title: Leaning Post Cuvée Winona 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a blend of 61% Merlot and 39% Cabernet Franc all sourced from Niagara-on-the-Lake that spent 18 months in French oak (mostly used barrels). Interestingly, the Cab Franc portion was fermented in concrete with the rest fermented in stainless steel. It has a big, heady nose of dense black cherries, blackberries, black currants, rich barrel spice notes and subtle earthy/savoury accents. It's bold and sassy on the palate with tannic grip and a firm structure with a range of dark berries, wild raspberries, licorice, eucalypt, fine oak spices, toasted vanilla bean, and a lifted, long finish. An impressive, bold red offering that can cellar 5+ years. Score - 91. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, Dec. 1, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This is a blend of 61% Merlot and 39% Cabernet Franc all sourced from Niagara-on-the-Lake that spent 18 months in French oak (mostly used barrels). title: La Ferme du Mont Première Côte Côtes du Rhône 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine always overdelivers, prompting many to refer to it as a baby Châteauneuf-du-Pape. There's power here, but it's beautifully contained and balanced. A glorious Côtes du Rhône.

raw_ec_shortdesc: The history of Evans & Tate dates back to 1971, when John Evans and John Tate first planted vines in Western Australia's Swan Valley. title: Fonjoya Grand Velours Grande Réserve 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Fonjoya is the collaborative project of two wineries, one in Saint-Félix-de-Lodez and one in Saint-Saturnin-de-Lucian. raw_ec_shortdesc: Similar to the Ripasso method, the Tuscan Governo method involves introducing sun-dried grapes to the fermentation process to add richness to the wine. title: Domaine Fond Croze Le Serre de la Garde Côtes du Rhône 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sourced from organically grown grenache (70%) and syrah (30%) that come together here to produce a lovely, soft-textured wine that's flavourful and well structured. The nicely layered flavours are mainly dark fruit, and they're balanced by well-calibrated acidity that has an attractive edginess. There's a little grip left in the tannins, but they are essentially resolved. It's drinking very well now and will hold another six years or so.  Score - 92. (Rod Phillips, Sept. 2023)

title: Domaine Gouron Chinon 2023
raw_ec_shortdesc: One of my favourite entry level cabernet franc, very consistent throughout vintages. Cherry pie filling and red bell pepper jelly aromas mingle with laurel and a dash of pepper. Softly textured on the palate with ripe cherry and tangy pomegranate flavours, it shows a gentle grip of polished tannins before ending on a crunchy red fruit and slightly peppery note. This is your go to bottle for stuffed bell pepper or cabbage rolls. Drink now. Exceptional Value! Score - 91. (Louise Boutin, winecurrent.com, March 13, 2024)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Unabashedly bold, Don David Reserve Malbec revels in its concentrated fruit and oaky character. Pair with grilled lamb chops.

title: Château Magnol 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Lovely weight and expression on the palate, a good juicy core that strikes just the right balance between high acidity giving freshness and life and ripeness of fruit which gives body and structure. Excellent vein of cooling minty freshness throughout which lingers long on the palate. This has a really lovely sugary hit on the mid palate too which is so appealing. Lots of nice elements here. Will be excellent in time. Not for long ageing, drinking young and enjoy the exuberance. Good extraction on show I think. Drinking window: 2024-2030. Score - 91. (Georgina Hindle, decanter.com, June 5, 2022)

title: Elderton Ode To Lorraine Cabernet Sauvignon/Shiraz/Merlot 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: An exceptional vintage produced this refined tribute to co-founder Lorraine Ashmead. Vivid in hue and on the palate, with fresh, juicy blackcurrant and blueberry, lacy, bitter chocolate and alluring riffs of sage (predominantly), spearmint and green peppercorn. Fine but layered pencil shaving tannins add a classic touch to this Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot blend. Very persistent, poised finish. Fruit is sourced from Nuriootpa vines planted between 1894 and 2017. Drinking window: 2024-2035. Score - 95. (Sarah Ahmed, decanter.com, April 7, 2024)

title: Casa di Luigi Pinot Noir KPM
raw_ec_shortdesc: Chile's Central Valley region runs for 400 kilometres from the Maipo Valley in the north to the Maule Valley. It's often mistaken for the geological Central Valley, which runs north-south for more than 1,000 kilometres between the Coastal Range and the Chilean Andes. Cool areas in river valleys, coastal sites, and the Andean foothills allow for Pinot Noir with notable freshness, dark fruit and spice.

This is quite approachable now, with its medium body and chalky tannins that melt away with the savory fruit on the palate. Excellent length. Already drinkable, but give it another year to allow it to develop more complexity. [This will drink through 2028.] Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, May 6, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Sweet plums and red and black berries with a savory edge of dried meat, licorice and iron. title: Alianca Bairrada Reserva
raw_ec_shortdesc: An intense and complex Reserva dominated by the indigenous Baga grape varietal. The aromas are concentrated with smoky notes followed by dark plum, licorice and spice. The palate is firm, redolent of smoke and prune, spice and toast flavours with a dry, fruity, persistent finish. Pair with steak, lamb and hearty stews.

raw_ec_shortdesc: Sourced from the exceptional vineyards of Argentina's Mendoza region, Argento Estate Cabernet Sauvignon is a modern-styled red destined for enjoyment. title: Angus The Bull Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: The philosophy behind this Australian cabernet sauvignon was to create the perfect pairing for beef. They succeeded! title: Anakena Nuna Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: The wines of Anakena are grown in excellent volcanic soil nestled between the Andes mountains and the Pacific Ocean. The Cabernet Sauvignon shows aromas of blackberry fruit with hints of cassis and spice. Berry fruit flavours with subtle vanilla are balanced by ripe acidity and tannins with good length on the finish.

title: Trapiche Reserve Malbec
raw_ec_shortdesc: For over 120 years, Bodega Trapiche has been producing and innovating Argentinian wine. Try this robust Malbec with red meats, hearty cheeses or earthy vegetables.

title: Terrazas de los Andes Reserva Malbec
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine is sourced from vines ranging from 20 to 80 years of age planted at 1,070 metres above sea level. A wine that will cellar well and delight with grilled ribs.

title: The Grinder Pinotage
raw_ec_shortdesc: First cultivated in South Africa in 1925, Pinotage-based are heralded for their dark berry and smoky flavours. With oak-aging, Pinotage takes on richer espresso-like notes, which have become a signature characteristic of these wines. The Grinder boasts smoky mocha and plum flavours with smooth, silky tannins.

title: Travaglini Gattinara 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Complex wine where the graceful aromas of sweet violets and pomegranates are allied to smoky woodland, licorice root and a whiff of cocoa powder. Firm on the palate, with a full body, dusty yet ripe tannins and long, crisp acidity. This 2020 is powerful and not without grace. It will improve further with bottle aging. Best after five to 10 years. Score - 95. (jamessuckling.com, July 9, 2024)

title: Pian delle Querci Brunello di Montalcino 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Classic and decidedly engaging, it shows notes of red plums, wild strawberries, mandarin juice, blood orange, lemon peel, rose petals, pink grapefruit, jasmine flowers and elderflower. title: Sogrape Vila Regia Douro DO
raw_ec_shortdesc: Vila Regia is a classic Douro red blend of Portuguese grape varietals. Expect aromas of dried fruit with dark plums, red berries, and light earthy and herbal notes. The palate is dry and medium-bodied with red and dark fruit flavours, light spice, and cedar notes. Enjoy it with grilled Portuguese chicken and red meat.
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Vila Regia is a classic Douro red blend of Portuguese grape varietals. Expect aromas of dried fruit with dark plums, red berries, and light earthy and herbal notes. The palate is dry and medium-bodied with red and dark fruit flavours, light spice, and cedar notes. Enjoy it with grilled Portuguese chicken and red meat.

title: Sandbanks Sleeping Giant VQA
raw_ec_shortdesc: This award-winning red from Prince Edward County is a showcase of elevated rusticity. Crafted with Ontario's stalwart hybrid varietals, Marechal Foch and Baco Noir, Sleeping Giant bursts with bold, rustic flavours. Rich berry, cassis, vanilla and oak flavours erupt from each sip. Enjoy with hearty stews or saucy barbecue.

raw_ec_shortdesc: This is pale, aromatic, floral, elegant and pretty, with tons of rose petals and an ethereal palate with ultra fine tannins. This is an awesome wine and value. title: Parajes del Valle Ecológico Monastrell 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A lifted, crisp Monastrell with a delicious core of red fruit and vibrant pink citrus. A Monastrell for summer! Drinking window: 2024-2025. Score - 91. (Ines Salpico, decanter.com, Oct. 9, 2023)

raw_ec_shortdesc: This balanced wine is sourced from vineyards beside the Corbarola River, where the vines benefit from extra sunshine provided by the water's reflection. title: Melini Chianti Classico Riserva DOCG
raw_ec_shortdesc: The combination of tradition and innovation is a cornerstone of modern Tuscan wines. Eighteen months in oak imparts structural depth and intense aromas of rich vanilla and spice. title: Mildiani Semi-Sweet Red Kindzmarauli
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is an off-dry red based on Georgia's saperavi grape. It has a generous, soft and ripe nose of plummy, raspberry fruit, lilac and white chocolate. Very pretty. And it is very smooth, semi-sweet and polished. It is really very well made and balanced with fine tannin. The length is very good as well. Chill a bit and consider for mellow, after dinner situations lightly chilled. Tasted March 2023. Score - 89. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)

title: Masi Campofiorin IGT
raw_ec_shortdesc: Masi created Campofiorin in 1964, utilizing the rich residual pomace leftover from Amarone production to add depth to their Valpolicella.  What they created is now called Ripasso, one of the most famous Italian wines. The wine is dry and medium-bodied with fig, cherry and spice flavours. Pair with lamb and polenta.

title: Marchesi di Barolo Barbaresco
raw_ec_shortdesc: From one of Piedmont's most venerable and respected producers, this wine offers superb value for Barbaresco. Sourced from clay and limestone soils covered by quartz and fine silt, it's quite aromatic, with cherry, earth, cloves, herbs and spice. A fine, distinguished wine that will drink well tonight with braised beef and has the potential to cellar for another 10-15 years.
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: From one of Piedmont's most venerable and respected producers, this wine offers superb value for Barbaresco. A fine, distinguished wine that will drink well tonight with braised beef and has the potential to cellar for another 10-15 years.

title: Knappstein Clare Valley Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Surely a contender for value buy of the year. Indeed, the range of four reds released here is definitely odds on for best buying collection for 2023. Maroon purple, this is a brooding, deep red with aromas of plums, chocolate, cigar boxes, dry herbs and raspberries - the black fruits kick in much more on the palate. There is good density, but the wine retains its freshness. With very fine tannins and a lingering finish, this is utterly delicious and should remain so for at least the next six to eight years. The palate exhibiting more chocolate, axle grease and blackberries as it develops in the glass. Terrific stuff. Drink by: 2023-2031. Score - 93. (Ken Gargett, winepilot.com, July 2023)

title: The Stump Jump Grenache Shiraz Mourvèdre
raw_ec_shortdesc: Legend suggests that Richard Bowyer Smith, who was a South Australian blacksmith and the inventor of the stump-jump plough (which allows ploughs to jump tree roots in difficult terrain), had poor eyesight, hence the optometrist chart on the label. This wine has a supple mouthfeel, with raspberry, plum, dark cherry, earth and savoury herbs. It will see its way clearly to drinking through 2025+.

raw_ec_shortdesc: This seductive red exemplifies Chile's ability to produce nuanced, international wine styles. The Diablo Dark is a dazzling, flavour-packed red with a slightly off-dry profile. title: Errázuriz Max Carmenère 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Max Carmenère may not be the sexiest wine in the Errázuriz line up, but it's often one of my favourites, delivering impressive value for money too. Smooth, refreshing and elegant, with liquorice, black cherry and patisserie flavours, filigree tannins and not a sign of vegetal greenness. Drink date: 2024-2030. Score - 94. (timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2023)

title: Coral Duero enVena Tinta de Toro 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Coral Duero's vineyards contain some of the oldest vines in Spain, with many pre-phylloxera plantings dating back more than 140 years. This Tinta de Toro, a.k.a. Tempranillo, comes from vines that are a mere 50 years of age! It shows expressive, bold, generous floral tones atop ripe fruit and sweet spices. Enjoy through 2027+.

title: Château Gazin Rocquencourt 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2016 Gazin Rocquencourt is gorgeous, radiant and incredibly inviting, just as it was en primeur. Blackberry jam, chocolate, cloves, spice and new leather are all fused together, but it is the wine's textural depth and impeccable balance that make it absolutely irresistible. This is an especially overt, racy style. What a joyous wine this is. Drinking window: 2022-2041. Score - 94. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Jan. 18, 2019)

title: Pesquié Édition 1912m Ventoux 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Already blended but awaiting bottling when I tasted it in July 2023, the tank-aged 2022 Ventoux Edition 1912M is an assemblage of 70% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 10% Cinsault. title: Southbrook Triomphe Organic Merlot 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Ontario's 2019 vintage threw many a curveball at winemakers, including some wild fall weather, but created wines of exceptional freshness. Varieties that ripen in the early-to-mid-season, such as Pinot Noir, Gamay and Merlot, did particularly well. This Merlot offers plum, blackberry, chocolate, smoke and spice, with the crisp acidity of the vintage. Rich, supple and long, it will drink through 2027+.

title: Le Clos Jordanne Jordan Village Pinot Noir 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a perfumed and poised, yet flavourful and structured example of Ontario pinot noir, made by talented and passionate winemaker, Thomas Bachelder. Oak-derived spices are seamlessly woven into a silken palate infused with fleshy red berries, dark cherries, dried herbs, and the beguiling scent of fresh magnolias. This is a wine that is already balanced and integrated, though it will benefit from a year or two in the cellar. The finish is long and intense, ending on a spice-infused note. Tasted April 2024. Score - 92. (Megha Jandhyala, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This is a perfumed and poised, yet flavourful and structured example of Ontario pinot noir, made by talented and passionate winemaker, Thomas Bachelder. Oak-derived spices are seamlessly woven into a silken palate infused with fleshy red berries, dark cherries, dried herbs, and the beguiling scent of fresh magnolias. This is a wine that is already balanced and integrated, though it will benefit from a year or two in the cellar. The finish is long and intense, ending on a spice-infused note. Tasted April 2024. title: Stoney Ridge Small Lot Bucknall Vineyard Gamay Noir 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Though marked by a relatively small crop size, the 2022 vintage in Ontario produced stellar reds, and Gamay was among those whose quality of fruit shone particularly brightly. Drinking well now, it will continue to evolve through 2026+.

title: Masseria Altemura Sasseo Primitivo 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Worth holding your nose to the glass for a while, to eke out the plummy, slightly chocolaty fruit character, together with an interesting, sweaty mineral note that turns to a more herbal trait. Medium-bodied with good intensity and balance and more straightforward fruit flavors. The tannins are sunk into the wine, allowing for a racy, fresh and almost tangy fruit finish. Lots going on here. Drink now. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, Aug. 16, 2023)

title: Angove Family Crest Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: From a range of sites of varied geology, this was fermented in open concrete vats with indigenous yeasts; élevage in French oak puncheons and hogsheads. From a cool year, there's notable elegance to this, though the fruits are both red and black - dark cherry and plum, blackberry, raspberry - accented with a tarry, charry note, master stock spices, mint, cacao nibs and cracked earth and iron-like mineral notes. It over-delivers at this tariff. Drink from: 2023. Drink by: 2031. Special Value. Score - 92. (winecompanion.com.au, Feb. 4, 2024)

title: Cafayate Terroir de Altura Malbec 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Another of Etchart's very good and fruity malbecs, this includes 10% bonarda to give it even more fruit. Made with 10% stems in the fermentation, it has a good network of tannins that pierce the palate and call for meat. Aging lasted 10 months, but all in used oak to help shape those tannins. A very good value for money here, in a typical malbec from Cafayate, an area where the sun abounds. Score - 91. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)

title: Barón de Ley Gran Reserva 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Lovely, classic-smelling Rioja Gran Reserva here from stalwart Barón de Ley, complete with toasted coconut, sandalwood, cedar and melted butter flavours, also dried cherry fruit and wild herbs. I love the silky-firm texture, the sapid and saline qualities, the genuine substance and depth. Textbook wine all around, enjoyable now but surely no rush; cellar into the thirties without concern. Tasted July 2024. Score - 92. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)

title: Wakefield Jaraman Shiraz 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Youthful, lifted aromas of blackberry, mulberry, satsuma plum, sweet spice and cedary oak. The palate is dark, juicy and mouth-filling. There's a drive of pure dark fruits along with bramble, dark chocolate, licorice and mint. The tannins are firm and structured and the acidity brings cut and snap to the finish. Big, bold, juicy and very nicely balanced. Drink date: 2024-2034. Score - 95. (Aaron Brasher, therealreview.com, May 25, 2024)

title: Peter Lehmann The Barossan Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Many accredit Peter Lehmann with saving the Barossa Valley wine industry in the 1970s. He sourced and blended surplus grapes from dozens of winemaking families, crafting wines that would get small local operations through tough times. A man of the people, his spirit is alive in this Barossan blend, with its flavours of blueberry jam, peppery spice, and flecks of coconut shavings.

title: Southbrook Triomphe Gamay 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Hogan prefers that the estate Gamays have some oak, in this case 100% neutral French oak for 9 months, to give the wines added texture and complexity. It shows lovely brambly raspberries, plums, dark cherries, and rhubarb with pepper, herbs, and anise accents. It's smooth on the palate with modest structure then bright red berries, savoury/earthy notes, plums, red currants and subtle pepper and spice all leading to a vibrant finish. Can cellar 3+ years if so inclined but drinking great right now. Score - 92. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, April 18, 2023)

title: Karas Red Blend 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Karas's winemaker, Gabriel Rogel, is from Argentina and crafts this wine in collaboration with oenological consulting legend Michel Rolland. This blend of Syrah, Malbec and Cabernet Franc is sourced from mostly volcanic soils at an altitude of 1,000-1,100 metres. It will deliver big dark fruit, smoke, spice and earth in a ripe, velvety frame.

title: Escudo Rojo Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: All from vineyards in the Buin area, near Alto Maipo, on the alluvial terraces of the southern bank of the Maipo River and beside the BPR winery in the Maipo Valley. These are 20-year-old vines that have produced this delicious juice of red fruits with spicy notes and a bit of herbs. The palate has very fine, firm tannins and lively acidity. The wine flows through the mouth. A surprising value for money here because of how delicious it is although especially because it offers a sense of place. And at this price, that's not common. [Drink through 2027+.] Score - 92. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)

title: Château Jérémie 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: There's a refreshing herbaceous lift in this delicious red, which nicely offsets the dense, ripe fruit profile. Cherry, plum and red currant fill out the palate, flecked with smoked meat, violet, forest floor and mineral details. Pencil shavings line the finish, marked by black pepper and smoke. Shows great character and balance. Carignan, Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now [to 2026]. Ranked #86 in Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 2023. Score - 92. (Kristen Bieler, winespectator.com, Oct. 15, 2023)

title: Château Larose-Trintaudon 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a little reticent than some of the wines presented in this vintage on the nose, but with time it reveals the scents of black pepper, blackcurrant and vanilla cream. The palate shows a very complete substance, fresh and convincing, quite seamless in style, with some ripe grip underneath it. An impressive composition overall, very elegant and correct, albeit with a flourish of tannins in the finish. A very promising start, and a long, lingering, tannin-infused finish. Very good, with fine cellaring potential.  [This will hold into the early 2030s.] Score - 94. (Chris Kissack, thewinedoctor.com, Sept. 2018)

title: Zuccardi Serie A Malbec 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The varietal Serie A range includes wines from the 'Argentinean' varieties, and the star of this range is, of course, the 2022 Serie A Malbec. Here they search for typicity from Valle de Uco, with freshness and flowers, red rather than black fruit, nice tannic structure and purity; they are not looking for complexity or limestone but varietal character, at which this excels. This has juiciness and structure and is fine-boned. It is very different from the Bonarda in this range. Drink date: 2023-2026. Score - 92. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Nov. 30, 2022)

title: Sidewood Mappinga Shiraz 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: 100% Shiraz. A dark and malty, concentrated wine with some spicy and whole bunch elements. There are bilberries, loganberries and a basket of wild Scottish dark blue fruits on the palate, with vanilla extract, earthy and savoury mushroom flavours. An enticing, complex and spicy wine which will do well with time. [This will drink well into the early 2030s.] Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2022)

title: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Domaine de Thalabert Crozes-Hermitage 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Lots of black and green pepper in the nose, but also lots of blackberry fruit. Impressive concentration and full supple tannins that give this considerable power at the long velvety and earthy finish. Excellent aging potential, and that's rare in this vintage. From organically grown grapes. Drink or hold. Score - 93. (Stuart Pigott, jamessuckling.com, May 22, 2023)

title: Villa Wolf Pinot Noir 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: German Pinot Noir (a.k.a. Spätburgunder) is increasingly being seen as an appealing stepping stone between the cerebral elegance of Burgundy and the boisterous fruit of New Zealand, and much of that reputation is based on the quality of wines coming from Pfalz. This one is ripe and spicy, with an elegantly achieved underlying smokiness. Try it with smoked salmon.

title: Nardelli Negroamaro/Primitivo 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine is mostly Negroamaro with a dash of Primitivo. Both varieties are sourced from vines that grow in soils rich in calcareous stone and benefit from cool morning breezes, allowing for good balance and freshness as the grapes ripen. Look for tangy dark berry, spice and earth, and pair with grilled chicken or mildly spiced ribs.[Luca Maroni tasting note not available.] Score - 96. (lucamaroni.com, 2024)

title: Gérard Bertrand An 990 Fitou Grenache/Carignan 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Gérard Bertrand's terroir-based expressions have been central to the re-emergence of the Languedoc as a premium-quality wine region. This example showcases Grenache and Carignan from Fitou and is crafted in an international style that makes it exceptionally accessible and gives it broad appeal. Look for ripe dark fruit, currant, roasted coffee bean, chocolate, spice and clove.

title: Xavier Vignon Lirac 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This vintage is due in Sept 2024 in Ontario. I tasted it with Xavier Vignon months earlier, where, amid several other wines, it showed the lovely rounded, soft yet balanced ambiance I have come to expect of Lirac, a small appellation on the other side of the river from Chateauneuf du Pape. The nose shows generous ripe, strawberry/cherry jam, subtle pepper and florals. It is medium-full bodied with moderated alcohol and very fine, sandy tannin. The length is excellent. No need to age this. Tasted Nov 2023. Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This vintage is due in Sept 2024 in Ontario. I tasted it with Xavier Vignon months earlier, where, amid several other wines, it showed the lovely rounded, soft yet balanced ambiance I have come to expect of Lirac, a small appellation on the other side of the river from Chateauneuf du Pape. The nose shows generous ripe, strawberry/cherry jam, subtle pepper and florals. It is medium-full bodied with moderated alcohol and very fine, sandy tannin. The length is excellent. No need to age this. Tasted Nov 2023. Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)

title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées Vieilles Vignes La Rose Pourpre 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A smile-inducing wine that is deep purple in color, it's a vortex of black fruit that begins with boysenberry, black raspberry and blackberry and decrescendos into dried hay, young cedar and Darjeeling tea. Black fruit is joined by orange citrus peel, Alpine strawberry and just-ripened red cherry on the palate and completes with a finish that is mulled-wine reminiscent. Score - 90. (Reggie Solomon, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2024)

title: Kartuli Vazi Naturally Semi-Sweet 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This naturally semi-sweet red is made from Georgia's most famous grape: Saperavi. Grapes are harvested late and fermentation is halted halfway through the process by chilling the fermenting juice, resulting in a wine with low alcohol and a pleasant sweetness. Expect notes of ripe black plum, sugared dates and pomegranate, with a core of zippy acidity and spicy tannins for balance.

title: Alandes Paradoux VII Edition Red Blend
raw_ec_shortdesc: Alandes ('along the Andes') seeks to offer Karim Mussi's view of the mountain wines that arise from the foot of the mountains in the Uco Valley. In this blend, there's merlot, cabernet franc, petit verdot, and cabernet sauvignon from three places in Uco: La Consulta, Los Chacayes, and Gualtallary. They were fermented separately in concrete vats and then aged in barrels for 12 months. This is a dense wine full of aromatic nuances where lots of black fruits, spices, and herbal tones converge in a powerful body with pronounced acidity, although with very fine, well-shaped tannins. One to make room for in the cellar and to keep for many years. Score - 95. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2022)

title: Bachelder Wismer-Parke Single Vineyard Pinot Noir 2022

(Christopher Waters, watersandwine.com, Nov. 1, 2024)

title: Stratus Wildass Red 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Red is likely to be one of the last you will see of this Stratus label as it has since been eliminated from the portfolio. The '19 mix is cabernet franc, petit verdot, cabernet sauvignon, merlot and sangiovese for a junior case in point to the Grand Vin of similar blending nature. This 2019 is simple and trustworthy, a wine so clean and focused with a distinct raspberry-ness, tart and faintly sweet while lending its emphasis for acidity to prevail. It's also a bit tannic, more than other vintages and so there is some structure and power to this one. It may just age a few more years than most might want to give it credit for. Good swan song if it happens to be the last Wildass Red. Put a few aside. What is there to lose? Drink 2023-2027. Tasted November 2023. Score - 89. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

title: Koncho Kindzmarauli 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Kindzmarauli is highly regarded as one of the top wines of Georgia; a country with an astounding 8,000-year wine history. It's a late-harvest wine made with the local grape Saperavi (whose name means 'paint' or 'dye' in reference to the deep colour of the wines it produces) and matured for two years before release. Serve chilled with desserts, fruit, or blue cheeses.

title: Tommasi Casisano Brunello di Montalcino 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Lovely capture of fruit from the warm 2017 vintage that while over-stressed it is important to note each and every producer that found the way. To capture freshness and that honesty of sangiovese spirit, here from Montalcino's south and with fortuitous elevation to keep the acids and the energy alive. Well done Tommasi, what else to say. Bravo. Drink date: 2022-2026. Tasted November 2021. Score - 92. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

title: Zuccardi Concreto Malbec 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: What a perfumed nose with plenty of violets, iodine, blueberries and mineral. Lots of sappy fruit with fine-grained tannins that tightly wrap the full-bodied palate. Pristine, concentrated and quintessential. A selection of the stoniest soils from Paraje Altamira. 100% whole-bunch fermentation. Needs at least two years to soften the tannins. Drink from 2025. [This has the potential to see the mid-2030s.]  Score - 95. (Zekun Shuai, jamessuckling.com, March 27, 2023)

title: Torbreck Old Vines Grenache/Mourvèdre/Shiraz 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Australia is home to some of the oldest ungrafted Grenache, Mataro (a.k.a. Mourvèdre) and Shiraz (a.k.a. Syrah) in the world, and Torbreck has plots that range up to 160 years. Made from fruit picked by hand, this wine is aged for 24 months in old French oak. Rich and plush, it delivers ripe red and dark fruit, spice, and delicate smoke and earth tones.

title: Volcanic Hills Magma Red 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine is sourced from Volcanic Hills's own estate vineyards in West Kelowna as well as from select growers in Osoyoos. Each grape variety is fermented and barrel aged separately in a mix of French and American oak for 12-16 months, depending on the grape. The resulting wine is charismatic, rich and complex, with black cherry, plum, clove, mint, chocolate and spice.

title: Tedeschi Maternigo Amarone della Valpolicella Riserva 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: A hailstorm devastated production in 2015, so 2016 becomes the first vintage of Maternigo Amarone Classico Riserva - and there won't be a 2017 or 2018. From the low-vigour Barila vineyard on the Maternigo estate to the east of the denomination, the grapes were picked just before perfect ripeness to retain freshness. The wine is the result of 100 days of grape drying, followed by a long 40-day fermentation and 90-day maceration, then 48 months in Slavonian oak and 12 months in bottle. Spicy, woody black cherry, blueberry jam and coffee scents are joined by deep, rich, earthy and almost-jammy flavours, with cocoa and damson. Round and extremely fresh with a persistent finish, this is by no means a shrinking violet yet has the balance to match its considerable concentration and heft. Drinking window: 2024-2037. Score - 97. (James Button, decanter.com, Sept. 10, 2023)

title: Tawse Growers Blend Cabernet Franc 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: A generous, ripe year for Niagara growers, this 2020 cabernet franc puts the vintage, and talented winemaking, on full display in a style that's somewhere between the Loire and Bordeaux. Absent are the variety's leafy-herbal pyrazines, traded in for riper red and black fruit, while wood is a minor contribution to the overall profile. Length and depth are very good, and in the final summary, this is a sharp value in one of Ontario's strongest varietal categories. Drink now-2028 or so. Tasted July 2023. Score - 91. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: A generous, ripe year for Niagara growers, this 2020 cabernet franc puts the vintage, and talented winemaking, on full display in a style that's somewhere between the Loire and Bordeaux. title: Wolf Blass Grey Label Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: If you love those generous, plush, richly flavoured McLaren Vale reds, oozing chocolate and black fruits, then you will go wild over this wine. Best of all, at this price fill the cellar, stunning value. The wine is fermented by way of individual vineyard batches in small open-top fermenters for between five and fifteen days. Maturation was for 17 months in a mix of 73% seasoned and 27% new French and American oak. A vibrant opaque purple, we have aromas of chocolate, cigar boxes, fruitcake and plums. There are black fruits, aniseed and cloves, that are plush and ever-so-generous. Abundant but cashmere-like tannins, gorgeous flavours and very good length with such a seductive and alluring texture. Drink over the next five to eight years, but good luck keeping your hands off it, after you've tried it once. This is undoubtedly the best buy from the Luxury Collection. Drink: 2023-2031. Score - 95. (Ken Gargett, winepilot.com, July 2023)

title: Vaeni Damaskinos Xinomavro Red Wine 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Damascenos is made from high-quality Xinomavro grapes grown in the Naoussa region. title: Viña Pedrosa Gran Reserva 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: Only made in the best vintages, such as 2008, 2010 and 2015, the Pedrosa Gran Reserva hails from two parcels - Valtarreña and El Espino - that are both over 60 years' old. Inky, dark and well structured, this is a wine that is built to age for a decade or more. Aged in new French and American oak, it's savoury, dense and just beginning to develop some balsamic undertones to complement the flavours of black fruits and dried herbs. Drink date: 2025-2035. Score - 96. (timatkin.com, Ribera del Duero 2020/21 Top 100)

title: Villa Pinciana Terraria 2013
raw_ec_shortdesc: 45% Sangiovese, 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Petit Verdot. Very Bordeaux in style, with cassis, red and black fruit, plus a hint of green savoury herbs. The wood integrates well and the red berry fruit becomes more concentrated on the mid-palate. Buoyant with flavour and textural through the long and rich finish. An ageing vinous beauty, with plenty of life left. [Drink through 2025.] Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Viña Casablanca Itera Seaside Journey 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: New to the Viña Casablanca range in 2021 - and further evidence that the bodega is pushing a few boundaries - this is a Pacific Ocean-influenced cuvée of mostly Pinot Noir with 40%Merlot, Barbera and Grenache. Clay amphora, concrete tank and old barrel-aged components combine attractively here, producing a wine that is savoury, grippy and perfumed, with some whole bunch spice and flavours of black cherry and raspberry. Drink date: 2023-2029. Score - 93. (timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2023)

title: Wynns Coonawarra Estate Black Label Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is the 66th vintage of this Australian classic. The first of these was made in 1954 and I am honoured to say that I have been fortunate to have tasted every one of these vintages through various verticals to celebrate milestones. The wine has never looked better from this exceptional Coonawarra vintage. It's classic Coonawarra, medium bodied with delightful regional and varietal characters. Leafy and slightly chalky tannin overlay to the vibrant blackcurrant fruit characters. The tannins are super fine and the oak so well played. Perfumed and alive, this is a wine for extended cellaring if you wish. Drink: 2023-2053. Score - 96. (Ray Jordan, winepilot.com, May 2023)

title: R. López de Heredia Viña Tondonia Reserva 2012
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2012 Viña Tondonia Reserva comes from a very dry year, with 25% less rain than the average (at the time), resulting in lower yields of very healthy grapes that delivered wines with nice balance between alcohol and polyphenols, making it very apt for the aging in barrel. It had a slightly longer élevage in barrel, six years. The wine is aromatic with a developed profile, spicy and tertiary (forest floor, a touch of brick dust and iodine), complex and nuanced. The palate is full and round, with polished tannins and a long, dry finish. It has a textbook Tondonia nose and profile. Drink date: 2025-2035. Score - 95. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Feb. 29, 2024)

Pair with hearty eggplant or mushroom dishes, or meaty stews.

title: Tenuta di Trinoro 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The flagship wine from Tenuta di Trinoro is this gorgeous blend of 92% Cabernet Franc and 8% Merlot. The 2020 Tenuta di Trinoro follows on the heels of the 2019 vintage that earned a perfect 100-point score. The 2020 vintage is more open-knit for sure, but it offers a very special view onto Cabernet Franc in particular. The plush black cherry softness of the Merlot is aligned magically with the dark intensity and tannic power of the Cabernet Franc. The fruit ripeness is impeccable and there are no green tones, nor are there any overripe nuances. Everything comes together with balance. For the first time, this wine is being released with an extra year of bottle age. Drink date: 2024-2048. Score - 97. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, May 31, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The flagship wine from Tenuta di Trinoro is this gorgeous blend of 92% Cabernet Franc and 8% Merlot. title: Two Sisters Eleventh Post 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: An assemblage of merlot, cabernet sauvignon and cabernet franc, vinified separately and then aged a substantial 30 months in French oak before being blended. Juicy and lush with a voluminous tannic mouthfeel, fresh red fruit, gentle oak spice and tertiary notes of iron, dried leaf and leather. Not too heavy, nicely balanced and with very good concentration and length. Best now to 2025. Tasted November 2022. Score - 91. (Sara d'Amato, winealign.com)

title: Viña Real Gran Reserva 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: The extremely affordable 2016 Viña Real Gran Reserva Especial recovers the 'Especial' mention from the old Reserva Especial vintages from a very good year. It's a classical Rioja Alavesa blend of 95% Tempranillo with 5% Graciano from their own vineyards. It's open and expressive, with notes of berries, fresh blood and iron, orange peel and sweet spices with the oak still present and in need of some more time in bottle. The palate is medium-bodied and feels lean and serious, with abundant chalky tannins. This should be a classical vintage of this wine in the making. It matured in barrel for two years and no less than three in bottle. It was bottled in March 2019. Drink date: 2023-2034. Score - 95. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, July 14, 2022)

title: Tarapacá 150 Anniversary Edition Gran Reserva Red Blend 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Tarapacá, under different ownership and management, has been producing wines for 150 years, always with a focus on Maipo Valley vineyards. This 68% cabernet sauvignon, 30% syrah, and 2% cabernet franc is entirely from estate-owned vineyards surrounding the Tarapacá winery in Isla de Maipo, planted on granite and clay soils. It's a red wine that's very much in the house's style - the smooth texture, the herbal and fruity aromas in similar measure, the very fine, sharp tannins. Score - 93. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)

title: Torbreck Woodcutter's Shiraz 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: There's oodles of black currant and blackberry fruit here to start. It's spice flecked with a touch of chocolatey oak and a warm earthy, mineral core. title: Spy Valley Envoy Outpost Vineyard Pinot Noir 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sweetly fruited and seductively savoury, it's beautifully lifted on the nose showing dark berry, game, toasted spice and almond characters with a hint of dried herb nuance. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, July 2020)

title: Versado Malbec 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Versado estate malbec from Canadians Peter Gamble and Ann Sperling happens with a local team, that being Esteban (administrator for La Productiva); Oscar and Soledad (Caseros or caretakers) at Villa Viamonte. This may just be the most concentrated and yet graceful of all their 'entry-level' malbecs to date. There is a whole lot of barrel involved but my how smooth, silken and the whole package turns out to be. Remarkably perfumed in spite of all that wood, acids high, spirited and fine, tannins at peak performance. Needs time to unwind, unravel and fully integrate. I would personally not touch this wine for three years at least. Drink 2024-2029. Tasted November 2021. Score - 91. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

title: Tornatore Etna Rosso 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2020 Etna Rosso is remarkably pretty, leading off with dusty roses and dried strawberries complicated by suggestions of violet and lavender. This flows effortlessly across the palate with floral-laced red fruits enhanced by sour citrus and spice. The 2020 lingers incredibly long yet maintains a lovely inner freshness. The 2020 is exceptionally pure and impossible to resist. Drinking window: 2024-2028. Score - 92. (Eric Guido, vinous.com, Sept. 14, 2023)

title: Sister's Run Old Testament Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Coonawarra region is unique in viticulture thanks to its abundance of gum trees. The sap and pollen from the trees extends to nearby vineyards and imparts a distinctly floral, camphoraceous character to the wines. Offering flavours of cassis and black licorice accented by aromas of eucalyptus and mint, this lovely red is sure to impress your guests.[The Melbourne International Wine Competition did not include a tasting note.] Score - 94. (Melbourne International Wine Competition, 2023)

title: Tbilvino Alazani Valley Medium Sweet Red 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: 'Saperavi' is the Georgian word for 'paint' or 'dye,' which is fitting considering it's also the name of one of the few teinturier (red-fleshed) grapes that you'll commonly find. This lush, off-dry red has flavours of pomegranate and strawberry with hints of forest floor balanced by a brisk acidity and velvety tannins.

title: Sur de los Andes Reserva Malbec/Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Malbec - Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva is 50% Malbec, 46% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Merlot from Luján de Cuyo and the Uco Valley and was 50% aged for six months in used French and American 225/500-liter barrels and 50% in stainless steel and concrete vats. Garnet red with a purple sheen. The enticing nose delivers notes of plum, ash and green bell pepper. The 2021 is dry with finely-grained tannins. The taut, plush mouthfeel produces a bold, terse palate with a pyrazine-inflected finish. Drinking window: 2023-2031. Score - 91. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, Sept. 7, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2021 Malbec - Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva is 50% Malbec, 46% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Merlot from Luján de Cuyo and the Uco Valley and was 50% aged for six months in used French and American 225/500-liter barrels and 50% in stainless steel and concrete vats. Garnet red with a purple sheen. The enticing nose delivers notes of plum, ash and green bell pepper. The 2021 is dry with finely-grained tannins. The taut, plush mouthfeel produces a bold, terse palate with a pyrazine-inflected finish. Drinking window: 2023-2031. Score - 91. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, Sept. 7, 2023)

title: Tedeschi Ansari Amarone della Valpolicella 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2019 Amarone della Valpolicella Ansari takes its time in the glass, initially darkly floral with an herbal tinge. Coaxing brings about an attractive blend of wild berries, violets and crushed stone. Silky and refined, this impresses with its perfect balance of ripe red and blue fruits offset by salty minerals and savory spice. Brisk acidity maintains a wonderfully fresh persona as the 2019 tapers off structured and long. Grippy tannins linger, and the mouth is left watering for more. Drinking window: 2026-2040. Score - 95. (Eric Guido, vinous.com, Feb. 29, 2024)

title: Tignanello 2008
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2008 Tignanello is unquestionably one of the wines of the vintage. The 2008 isn't a huge or obvious Tignanello, rather it is a wine that impresses for its sublime elegance and precision. Understated layers of fruit caress the palate like cashmere in this impeccable, soft wine. There is not a hard edge to be found. Black cherries, tobacco, smoke and licorice are some of the notes that come through on the finish. The flavor profile is decidedly on the dark side, but the wine's structure is medium in body and intensity. In 2008 the Tignanello has more energy, focus and length than the Solaia. It is a fabulous achievement! The 2008 Tignanello is 80% Sangiovese aged in 300-liter French oak barrels (1/3rd new), 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc, both aged in 100% new 225-liter French oak barriques. Drinking window: 2014-2024. Score - 94. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Aug. 2011)

title: Stark-Condé Three Pines Jonkershoek Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Three Pines site is located between 310 and 350 metres and has produced a humdinger of a wine in 2017. title: Sprucewood Shores Hawk's Flight Reserve Appasimento VQA
raw_ec_shortdesc: This red is named after the migratory path that brings a vast number of hawks to Sprucewood's vineyards, on the banks of Lake Eerie. This appasimento style red features concentrated aromas of black berry and red cherry with flavours of mocha, vanilla and nutmeg. Pair alongside Gorgonzola cheese on artisanal crackers.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina Crianza 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2019 Crianza is 100% Tempranillo sourced from San Vicente de la Sonsierra and Ábalos, Rioja Alta. Aged for 14 months in used American and French barrels (50/50), this purple wine showcases aromas of blackberry and blueberry, with hints of vanilla and coconut against an oak backdrop. Dry and juicy, the grippy palate lingers with a chalky texture, presenting a balanced expression of Rioja. Drinking window: 2024-2034. Score - 91. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, April 18, 2024)

title: Remo Farina Ripasso Valpolicella Classico Superiore 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Remo Farina Superiore 2019 Ripasso Valpolicella is a crowd-pleaser Classico and great value under $20. Rich, juicy and smooth on the palate, this medium-plus-bodied Veneto red is produced from 50% Corvina, 15% Corvinone, 20% Rondinella, 5% Molinara and 10% Oseleta. Look for dark cherry, sweet dried tobacco leaf, cracked pepper and baking spice flavours on the palate. Pour with grilled eggplant, roasted red pepper and buffalo mozzarella paninis. Drink: 2021-2027. Score - 91. (nataliemaclean.com, Dec. 19, 2021)

title: Shaw & Smith Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a beautiful release of Shaw + Smith Shiraz. It's even-handed and well tempered but then it's all joy from there. A forest of berries, a walk through flowers, peppers flung through and rubs of woodsy spice; the combination of fruitiness, savouriness, seriousness and fun is a highway to pleasure, built on wine. For all that the tannin is another dimension in itself; fine, lacy, assertive and savoury at once, complete with its own twiggy spice notes. It's drinking beautifully and it will continue to do so. Drink: 2024-2036+. Score - 96. (Campbell Mattinson, winefront.com.au, Oct. 21, 2022)

title: Sassicaia 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Here it is: A quintessential Sassicaia that represents the excellence of the vintage and also respects the unique taste profile of this distinguished Tuscan blend of Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc. The Tenuta San Guido 2021 Bolgheri Sassicaia offers impeccable balance, excellent freshness and absolutely no signs of over-ripeness. The fruit balance is ideal with a hint of crunch and lasting tension from pulp and skins. The tannins are deftly managed with firm grip and enough velvetiness to add volume and length. There is no greenness on the bouquet that instead offers mulled herbs and spice, with cinnamon and clove, layered delicately between mostly red and some purple berry fruits. Redcurrant, blueberry, sweet pomegranate and Rainier cherry run strong in this vintage. A fragrant hint of heritage rose emerges with time. The oak tones are geared toward gingerbread, hazelnut, cigar, sandalwood and something like a grilled sweet red pepper. To the palate, it offers nice weight with no heavy glycerin, and a rinse of acidity that adds to the wine's natural energy, brightness and viscosity. That marked freshness opens the wine up to long aging potential, but you still need to give it more time in bottle. Drink date: 2028-2060. Score - 100. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Jan. 4, 2024)

title: Señorío de Barahonda Carro 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Aromas of ripe black cherries and blackberries with hints of dried flowers, bark and wet soil. Medium- to full-bodied with creamy tannins and a round texture. Pure ripe-berry character on the palate with a lingering finish. Monastrell, syrah and merlot. Vegan. Drink now [through 2024]. Score - 90. (jamessuckling.com, Sept. 9, 2022)

title: Sogrape Grao Vasco Dao
raw_ec_shortdesc: Portugal's Dao region is home to some of Portugal's most celebrated red wines. Grao Vasco blends Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz grapes and, with meticulous winemaking, crafts a flavourful and complex wine with youthful red and black plum fruit, rye bread and chocolate flavours. Serve with grilled meats, game and poultry.

title: Reyneke Biodynamic Range Syrah 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Biodynamic Syrah from Reyneke's (Demeter-certified) vineyards in Stellenbosch. Earthy, herbal nose with hints of white pepper and lanolin. Medium-bodied, elegant and pure in the mouth. This is full of ripe, peppery red fruits, with plenty of freshness and some wild, roasted meat notes. Drinking window: 2023-2028. Score - 93. (Rupert Joy, decanter.com, June 22, 2023)

title: Salentein Reserve Malbec 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Malbec Salentein Reserve is a blend of grapes from Los Árboles and Paraje Altamira, Uco Valley and was aged for 12 months in used French (30%) and American (70%) barrels. Purple in the glass. The no-nonsense nose offers notes of ripe red fruit with a little fresh plum and hints of spice. It's voluminous in the mouth with polished tannins and fruity flavor enlivened by the precise freshness. A rewarding wine. Drinking window: 2022-2029. Score - 90. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, Nov. 3, 2022)

title: Serna Imperial Reserva 2010
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2010 vintage is considered an outstanding one for Rioja, with consistent weather patterns and optimal ripening. The older these wines get, the more you can appreciate the quality of this vintage. This example shows lovely flavours of dried fig, chili powder, tobacco, aged leather, cigar and coffee. This well-aged beauty will pair wonderfully with roast pig or black-bean chili.

title: Rymill Coonawarra Classic Release Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Blackberry pie (crust and all), licorice, cassis, star anise, bramble, garden mint, cigar box and tobacco leaf. In the mouth the wine is ultra-concentrated, firm and structured. This pays homage to both the variety and the region. It offers truth from every angle, leaving no lingering doubt about where this could possibly have come from, and what grape it is. It has a long life ahead of it. Drink from: 2022. Drink by: 2036. Score - 94. (Erin Larkin, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 3, 2022)

title: Quadrus Reserva 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Quadrus Reserva is grown and crafted in Portugal by Toronto-born brothers Tony and Mario Amaro of the famed Opus Restaurant. Vines for this wine are grown 650 metres above sea level in a terraced vineyard rich in schist. This lovely red is already mature and ready to enjoy, showing notes of red plum, beetroot, and dried herbs, with a touch of vanillin.

title: Smoke & Gamble Appassimento VQA
raw_ec_shortdesc: This red blend is made using grapes that have been partially dried in a former tobacco kiln. The result is a wine with deep garnet colour with concentrated aromas of blackcurrant and leather. Five years ageing in French and American oak barrels imparts toasty, smoky flavours. Pair with Pasta Bolognese.

title: Puelles Reserva 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: This bend of 94% tempranillo and 6% other Spanish varieties, all from old vines, was matured in oak for a total of 24 months. It delivers a very attractive and well-layered flavour profile dominated by dark fruit and some spiciness, all complemented by well-balanced acidity.  The texture is soft, and the tannins are well resolved. Drink now to the late 2020s. (Tasted February 2024.) Score - 93. (Rod Phillips)

title: San Alejandro Evodia 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Evodia comes from a cold year with snow, frost and some extreme temperatures (-18 degrees Celsius!) but an average rest of the season, some hail in July(!) and quite a lot of rain in early October, so not a year without challenges. They estimate a 25% decrease in yields, but the grapes picked before the rain delivered fresh wines with good aging potential. This finished at 14.6% alcohol and with good freshness and acidity. It fermented with some 15% full clusters in concrete, and 60% of the volume remained in concrete while the rest was equal parts in used 225-liter barrels and large oak vats for five months. It was a very challenging year, but the result feels great, a cooler and fresher vintage than 2020 and 2022. It's a fragrant Garnacha, a fruit-driven and juicy effort with super fine tannins and a balanced mouthfeel. Volume has gone down and price has gone up a bit, but the quality has also grown and it's still a great bargain. Drink date: 2023-2027. Score - 91+. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, May 31, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2021 Evodia comes from a cold year with snow, frost and some extreme temperatures (-18 degrees Celsius!) but an average rest of the season, some hail in July(!) and quite a lot of rain in early October, so not a year without challenges. title: Ruffino Chianti
raw_ec_shortdesc: This famous Chianti, Ruffino's flagship wine, has been produced since 1877. One of the most recognized Tuscan wines in the world, Ruffino Chianti is dry and well-structured, with balanced acidity perfect for food pairing. Aromas of leather, cherry, and pepper follow through onto the palate. Try it with lasagna.

title: San Silvestro Patres Barolo 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Delicate scents of rose petals, tar and dried herbs intertwine with hints of cherry and truffle in this captivating Barolo. On the palate, flavors of red berries and licorice are embraced by firm tannins, while lively acidity adds vibrancy. This Nebbiolo reveals a velvety texture, leading to a lingering, complex finish. Drink 2025-2040. Cellar Selection. Score - 93. (Jeff Porter, Wine Enthusiast, May 1, 2024)

title: Rtvelisi Mukuzani Dry Red 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine comes from Kakheti, which is Georgia's most important wine region in terms of total production, quality and historical significance. Once used solely to add colour and freshness to blends, the Saperavi grape has established itself as a superb single-varietal wine. This one is lush and generous, with damson plum, red cherry and firm tannins. Pair with roast pork.

title: San Pedro Sideral 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sideral is something of a second wine after Altaïr. They share the same origin, but Sideral is a different selection, which this year is 73% cabernet sauvignon, 11% syrah, 9% carmenere, 4% petit verdot, and 3% cabernet franc. The wine was aged for 16 months in oak barrels, 20% of them new, as well as in 2,000-liter foudres. It's usually released a year before Altaïr, and this year, it's a juicy wine full of aromatic notes and flavors of red fruits and herbs (cabernet franc and carmenere undoubtedly put their signature on this vintage) in a body of firm acidity (very much in tune with a cool season like 2021) and fine, sharp tannins. An elegant and subtle wine that will gain in complexity with another four or five years in the bottle. [This will continue to evolve through mid-2030s.]  Score - 95. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Sideral is something of a second wine after Altaïr. title: Piekenierskloof Six Hats Shiraz 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This 100% shiraz from a fairtrade South-African winery is simply spectacular, especially at this friendly price. It's generous on the nose with ripe black plum, mixed berry compote, freshly grated cinnamon and a lovely floral note in the background. There's a cooling freshness on the palate that showcases the dark cherry and plum flavours with a hint of zesty orange beautifully. Tannins are fine and polished and the finish is fruit forward yet dry and slightly peppery. This is a great partner to lamb burgers or rich ratatouille. Drink or cellar. Exceptional Value! Score - 92. (Louise Boutin, winecurrent.com, Sept. 11, 2023)

Drink date: 2024-2032. Score - 95. (timatkin.com, Rioja Special Report 2024)

title: Ntsiki Biyela Aslina Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: South Africa's first female black winemaker (her first vintage was 2014), Ntsiki Biyela named her Aslina label after her grandmother. Biyela grew up in KwaZulu-Natal and spent a year as a domestic worker before being offered a scholarship to study winemaking in 1999. She has worked harvests in Bordeaux and Tuscany, and her winemaking philosophy draws on this experience. This accomplished Cabernet contains 15% Petit Verdot, and underwent fermentation in stainless steel before ageing in used oak barrels for 14 months. It's a charming, harmonious wine, with fresh, fragrant black fruits, well-integrated oak and a hint of menthol. Super enjoyable now but will also develop over the next five or so years. Drinking window: 2022-2027. Score - 91. (Amy Wislocki, decanter.com, July 10, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: South Africa's first female black winemaker (her first vintage was 2014), Ntsiki Biyela named her Aslina label after her grandmother. Biyela grew up in KwaZulu-Natal and spent a year as a domestic worker before being offered a scholarship to study winemaking in 1999. She has worked harvests in Bordeaux and Tuscany, and her winemaking philosophy draws on this experience. This accomplished Cabernet contains 15% Petit Verdot, and underwent fermentation in stainless steel before ageing in used oak barrels for 14 months. It's a charming, harmonious wine, with fresh, fragrant black fruits, well-integrated oak and a hint of menthol. Super enjoyable now but will also develop over the next five or so years. Drinking window: 2022-2027. Score - 91. (Amy Wislocki, decanter.com, July 10, 2022)

title: Quinta da Falorca Touriga Nacional 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2015 Touriga Nacional Quinta da Falorca is a blend with more than 30 clones of Touriga Nacional from three different vineyards and was aged for 18 months in new French oak. It comes in at 14% alcohol. Fresh and expressive of its grape in flavor, it is also very aromatic and bright. This is an elegant Touriga that eschews jammy fruit. It goes for elegance, silky texture and liveliness more than big concentration in mouthfeel. This is a sunny delight and a little exuberant right now. It is more graceful than the typical 2015, it seems. This should improve nicely with age. Whatever the final result, it is a perfect food wine, and it will be a pleasure to drink. It is quite drinkable today, but it will continue to develop. Holding it another year or two would help. Drink date: 2020-2035. Score - 94. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2020)

title: Orma 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The cabernet sauvignon character comes through nicely in this red, particularly on the palate, with currants, both red and black, as well as dried flowers and cedar. Some lead pencil as well. Medium body, with polish, finesse and beauty. Lovely length and grace. This is a move towards better balance and energy for Orma. One to watch. A blend of mostly merlot with cabernet sauvignon and cabernet franc. Best after 2026, but already a very attractive young wine. Score - 97. (jamessuckling.com, Aug. 12, 2024)

title: Paul Jaboulet Aîné La Chapelle Hermitage 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The beautifully proportioned 2018 Hermitage La Chapelle comes across as a complex, complete version of this renowned bottling, with no rough edges - just moderate spice, cassis, red berries and cedar on the nose. It's medium to full-bodied, silky and fine, brimming with harmony and elegance on the palate, while the finish is long, echoing with cassis, charcoal and crushed stone. The tannins firm up a bit on the finish, so I suspect this will close down soon, then blossom sometime after 2025. Drink date: 2025-2040. Score - 98+. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, May 13, 2021)

title: Mosquita Muerta Pispi Red Blend 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The elegant and balanced 2018 Pispi is a blend of 40% Malbec, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Bonarda, 10% Petit Verdot and 10% Cabernet Franc sourced from different parts of Mendoza and produced in a very harmonious way. title: Pétrus 2010
raw_ec_shortdesc: Deep garnet colored, the 2010 Petrus opens a little broody, with gentle crushed rocks, cast iron pan and fragrant earth notions giving way to a core plum preserves, baked blueberries, licorice and Black Forest cake plus wafts of pencil shavings, garrigue and violets. Full-bodied, the palate is beautifully poised with a firm line of exquisitely ripe, fine-grained tannins and fantastic freshness bolstering the generous fruit, finishing very long and very, very classy. Collectors fortunate enough to have a few bottles of this vintage are advised to be patient and allow it a further 7-10 years to loosen-up and emerge gloriously from this rock-solid structure. Drink date: 2027-2070. Score - 100. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, March 5, 2020)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Fresh violets, lilac, wild plums, allspice and wild herbal aromas pour from the glass. title: Michele Castellani Cinque Stelle Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: A refined and very silky expression of Amarone with lots of crushed currants and berries that form a tight bead on the the full to medium palate. The tannins are quite firm and need time to bind with the fruit even better. Lovely hint of chocolate comes through. This is super clean and focused Amarone that is built to last. Delicious to taste, but give it until 2024. Score - 94. (jamessuckling.com, Oct. 22, 2021)

title: Masi Costasera Riserva Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: An Amarone that nudges Port, such is the density and liqueur-like notes of cocoa nibs, mocha, root spices and dried cherries. The tannins restrain the flavors into a sense of composure on one hand, while drying out the finish on the other. Very drying. Presumably, this simply needs time, or at least it is best to hope so. Drinkable now, but best from 2030 [through late 2030s]. Score - 93. (Ned Goodwin, MW, jamessuckling.com, May 3, 2024)

title: Mission Hill Oculus 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: A melding of opulence and elegance, the Oculus, a Bordeaux blend grown organically in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia, delivers serious New World fruit with sheer elegance. Strawberries and balsamic announce the aromatics of ample complexity and florality. Dried violets, savoury anise and gravelly dust complete the picture. The palate is gorgeously constructed as tannins and freshness interplay. Fresh mint and pine bough frame strawberries, clove and smoke. Well-knit wild mountain berries, pencil lead, and evergreen tips. Freshness, ripeness and structure come together wonderfully. Drinking window: 2023-2038. Score - 95. (Clive Pursehouse, decanter.com, Oct. 31, 2023)

title: Merayo Las Tres Filas Mencia 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: 100% Mencia. Our Best in Show journey across Northern Spain continues with a 2020 Bierzo, grown just across the provincial border from Galicia into Castilla y Léon. It's another zone of steep slopes and old vines - the variety in this case being Mencia (known as Jaen in Portugal's Dão region). This wine is deep black-red in colour and vivacious and urgent in aroma: wild plums mingled with the woodland scents of leaf, copse and forest floor. The palate is fruit-packed and vibrant, vigorous with an energy derived both from ripe acidity and fresh though smooth tannins; look out, too, for a stony, bitter-edged finish perhaps derived from the region's slate soils. Wonderful drinking now in the flush of youth, but fruit of this quality will hold well for a few years yet. Best in Show. Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: 100% Mencia. Our Best in Show journey across Northern Spain continues with a 2020 Bierzo, grown just across the provincial border from Galicia into Castilla y Léon. The palate is fruit-packed and vibrant, vigorous with an energy derived both from ripe acidity and fresh though smooth tannins; look out, too, for a stony, bitter-edged finish perhaps derived from the region's slate soils. title: Maison Champy Pernand-Vergelesses 2023
raw_ec_shortdesc: Vinified with natural yeasts and matured in oak barrels for 12 months, this wine is a reflection of the stony limestone vineyards that sit at the confluence of two valleys in the shadow of the Montagne de Corton. Intense and aromatic, it offers notes of ripe fruit, leather and mineral. Drinking beautifully now through 2029.

title: Mildiani Napareuli Red 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Crafted from Saperavi, this is a lithe, medium-bodied wine, with velvety tannins that have just the right amount of bite. title: M Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: I love this easy-to-drink 2021 Cabernet Sauvignon from McPrice Myers that well overdelivers for its price. Deep ruby-purple, it has alluring aromas of cassis, pencil shavings, dried herbs, leather and lavender, plus classy touches of oak spice. The full-bodied palate is concentrated and powerful without going over the top. It has abundant, grainy tannins, flinty streaks and plenty of refreshing acidity to carry the long finish. It's not your average chocolate bomb California Cabernet, despite its modest price tag. Drink date: 2023-2028. Score - 95. (Erin Brooks, robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: I love this easy-to-drink 2021 Cabernet Sauvignon from McPrice Myers that well overdelivers for its price. title: Mezzacorona Pinot Noir Vigneti delle Dolomiti IGT
raw_ec_shortdesc: Founded in 1904, Mezzacorona cultivates their pinot noir grapes in vineyards at foothills of the Italian Dolomites. Their pinot noir possesses bright red cherry, floral and blood orange fruits with a hint of vanilla. Its medium-bodied, fruity style makes it a great pairing for charcuterie, grilled salmon or roasted chicken.

title: Lungarotti Vigna Monticchio Riserva Rubesco Torgiano Rosso 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: The flagship wine of the beloved Lungarotti family, this has been considered one of central Italy's finest reds since its first vintage in 1964. It's frequently awarded the Tre Bicchieri from Gambero Rosso. This consistently fantastic red offers flavours of sour cherry and strawberry accented by notes of dried rosemary, licorice and leather, all neatly wrapped around a core of silky tannins that melt on the finish. [Luca Maroni tasting note not available.] Score - 99. (lucamaroni.com, June 26, 2023)
