title: Jeff Carrel Les Darons 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2022 Languedoc Les Darons brings more density and richness, with ripe black cherries, wild strawberry, ground pepper, and floral notes in a medium to full-bodied, pure, beautifully balanced package. The purity and balance here are top-notch. The blend is 70% Grenache, 25% Syrah, and the rest Carignan, from old vines, with the aging in concrete. This is going to be a smoking value. [This will evolve through 2030+.] Score - 92-94. (jebdunnuck.com, Aug. 8, 2023)

title: Kew Soldier's Grant 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this wine is made in a partial appassimento style with some of the fruit being dried before winemaking. The wine spends 16 months in a combo of French and American oak, creating a rich, round mouthfeel. Expect stewed blackberry, cherry and clove, and pair with caramelized-eggplant pizza, or seared duck with huckleberry sauce.

title: Majella The Musician Cabernet/Shiraz

title: Leyda Lot 8 Syrah 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Like a number of Chile's best Syrahs, Lot 8 is made entirely with clone 470. Fermented with 35% whole bunches and mostly aged in foudres, this is a wonderful cool climate expression of the grape, showing tapenade, lavender and pepper spice aromas and a compact, youthful palate of blackberry and black olive. Drink date: 2024-2032. Score - 95. (timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2023)

title: Haywire Secrest Mountain Pinot Noir 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This comes off their organically farmed Secrest Mountain Vineyard, a higher altitude site with calcium-carbonate laced alluvial and gravelled soils. This was native fermented, 50% whole cluster, with 4 weeks skin contact in concrete and stainless before basket pressing into concrete for 10 months. Wild plum, cherry, perfumed raspberry flood this lifted pinot, seasoned with scrubby desert shrubs and pink peppercorn, and hugged with finely grippy tannins through a textured, lingering finish. Beauty. Score - 91. (Treve Ring, gismondionwine.com, Oct. 21, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This comes off their organically farmed Secrest Mountain Vineyard, a higher altitude site with calcium-carbonate laced alluvial and gravelled soils. title: Kellerei Bozen Lagrein 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Deeply coloured and very fruity on the nose, with appealing black cherry and plummy notes leading, the Bolzano cooperative delivers another solid value here from this native red variety. It's soft and low in tannins per the textbook profile, while acids are comfortably ripe. I like the plump, juicy fruit on the palate, ripe but still fresh, and the lingering finish. Nicely done. Chill lightly and ready to go or hold short term. Tasted June 2024. Score - 90. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)

title: Lafazanis Geometria Agiorgitiko 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The most important grape of the Neméa PDO, Agiorgitiko (ah-your-YEE-tee-koh) is a bit of a chameleon, able to produce soft, fruity rosés, stunning dessert wines, and smooth, deep reds. This example from Lafazanis offers notes of freshly picked red berry and plum with distinct undertones of black licorice and ground nutmeg.

raw_ec_shortdesc: 'Almost too good,' mused Chris Mullineux when he poured this wine and I know what hemeans. title: La Massa Giorgio Primo 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2018 Giorgio Primo represents a new level of finesse at La Massa. Powerful and dense in the glass, with tremendous structure, Giorgio Primo is a terrific example of how compelling international varieties are in Panzano's Conca d'Oro district. Crème de cassis, spice, new leather, chocolate and sweet spice build into the textured, palate-staining finish. Drinking window: 2025-2038. Score - 97. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Sept. 2021)

title: Henschke Mount Edelstone Vineyard Shiraz 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Kaleidoscopic, this glorious vintage is terroir translucent, transporting you to the vineyard with its signature aromas of dried sage, Eucalyptus olida (aka Strawberry Gum), wild mint, wattleseed, nutmeg and tinder. Soaring and super-expressive, these scents bring compelling dimension and meld exquisitely on the sweet, juicy plum and bramble palate, with its cocoa nib and earthy hints. Graceful, willowy tannins and mineral acidity make for a long, fluid, markedly perfumed finish. Irresistible already! Drinking window: 2022-2042. Part of Henschke 2017 single-site Shiraz releases. Score - 98. (Sarah Ahmed, decanter.com, March 29, 2022)

title: Inniskillin Reserve Cabernet Franc
raw_ec_shortdesc: Clean, professionally made wine that takes advantage of the warm 2020 growing season in Ontario, Inniskillin's cabernet franc delivers a waft of good quality oak spice up front over dark berry fruit in the varietal idiom. The palate is medium-full (13.5% alcohol declared), with plenty of dark raspberry and vanilla flavour, supple but abundant tannins and balanced acids. Well made all in all, drinking now or hold 2-4 years. Tasted April 2023. Score - 90. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Clean, professionally made wine that takes advantage of the warm 2020 growing season in Ontario, Inniskillin's cabernet franc delivers a waft of good quality oak spice up front over dark berry fruit in the varietal idiom. title: Ivan Dolac Plavac Mali 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Plavac Mali is not unlike Zinfandel, to which it's related, but it tends to be bigger and more full-bodied. This smooth, expressive wine was aged in stainless steel for five years to preserve the purity of the berry fruit and has a refined minerality. Try it with grilled lamb or herb-infused roasted vegetables.

title: Heredad de Urueña Santo Terroir Tempranillo 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: Made solely from tempranillo and aged 10 months in new French and American barrels, this is a delicious wine that has everything going for it. You'll find the flavours rich (but not at all over the top) and layered, with excellent complexity and character. The acidity is perfectly tailored to the fruit and the tannins are well integrated. It's holding its style impressively. Drinking very well now, it looks set to live a vibrant life to the mid-to-late-2020s. Score - 92. (Rod Phillips, undated)

title: High on the Hog Red 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 High on the Hog is composed of 25% Grenache, 25% Zinfandel, 20% Syrah, 14% Petite Sirah, 12% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Mourvèdre. It's scented of red and black plums with touches of tar, turned earth, coffee, chocolate and spicy undertones. The medium to full-bodied palate has generous, juicy fruit, supple, approachable tannins and a long, flavorful finish streaked with spicy accents. This is very easy to drink and offers great quality for the price. Drink date: 2024-2030. Score - 93. (Erin Brooks, robertparker.com, Jan. 31, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2021 High on the Hog is composed of 25% Grenache, 25% Zinfandel, 20% Syrah, 14% Petite Sirah, 12% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Mourvèdre. It's scented of red and black plums with touches of tar, turned earth, coffee, chocolate and spicy undertones. The medium to full-bodied palate has generous, juicy fruit, supple, approachable tannins and a long, flavorful finish streaked with spicy accents. This is very easy to drink and offers great quality for the price. Drink date: 2024-2030. Score - 93. (Erin Brooks, robertparker.com, Jan. 31, 2024)

raw_ec_shortdesc: From legendary winemaker Ben Glaetzer (the man behind the iconic Amon-Ra Shiraz), this is Heartland's entry-level red. title: Clos Apalta 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: A generous array of ripe black and blue fruit with pink peppercorns, green olives, dried flowers, toffee and chocolate orange. It's full-bodied with firm, creamy and velvety tannins. Long and polished. Lovely salted caramel and olives at the end. Keeps going. Unfolds on the finish. 70% carmenere, 18% merlot, 8% cabernet sauvignon and 4% petit verdot. Drink or hold [for 15+ years]. Score - 99. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 28, 2022)

title: Herdade Peso Trinca Bolotas Tinto 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Aragonez (Tempranillo) is a solid reminder of the quality and value to be found in Portugal's vast selection of indigenous grapes. Delicate touches of spice and a gently tannic structure round out the wine beautifully.

title: Hess Collection Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Napa's 2022 vintage was a challenging one that produced a 'lighter style' of Cabernet than is typical for the region. But given the inherent power of Napa Cab, that's a truly relative descriptor. For the Allomi Cabernet, the heat led to small, tight berries packed with flavour; layered, complex notes of cassis, blackberry, tobacco and spice; and great balance and structure. Drink through 2034+.

title: Featherstone Red Tail Merlot 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: A ridiculously affordable price for a Merlot this good. The wine is aged in 100% fine French oak barrels (25% new) from Tonnellerie Sirgue Nuits Saint Georges for 10 months. There is an intriguing, perfumed note on the nose with dark cherries, black raspberries, cassis, integrated spices, and subtle earthy accents. It's rich with some tannic structure and weight on the palate followed by juicy red berries, anise, cassis, and elegant spice notes through a long, lifted finish. [You] can age this for 5+ years and you can feel pretty damn happy you paid only $20 a bottle. Score - 92. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, June 5, 2023)

title: H.J. Fabre Reserva Cabernet Franc 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Fabre buys grapes for this cabernet franc from the Alto Agrelo zone, about 1,100 meters above sea level and toward the beginning of the Andean foothills. It's a 100% cabernet franc from 20-year-old vines planted on alluvial soils. It has herbal aromas that combine with ripe red fruits in a wine whose palate shows its claws, with firm and reactive tannins surrounded by flavors of juicy fruit. Score - 92. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2023)

title: Fontanafredda Serralunga d'Alba Barolo 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: From 18 different areas within the Comune, the medium red 2020 Barolo Del Comune Di Serralunga D'Alba offers spicy notes of fresh cherries, raspberries, rosemary, incense, and orange peel. Medium-bodied and elegant, it's approachable now, with ripe tannins and very harmonious, savory notes of pure tea leaf on the finish. Very well-styled, it has a good sense of the village it hails from as well as the finesse this vintage offers. Drink it over the next 10-12 years. Maturity: 2024-2036. Score - 92. (Audrey Frick, jebdunnuck.com, May 13, 2024)

title: Finca Feliz Tesoro Criolla Grande 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The grapes for this wine come from 12-year-old vines, which are young in a Criolla context, since most of the grape's plantings are around 40 years old and some reported to be over 200. Fermented and aged in concrete, it's a lithe, food-friendly red, with red cherry, earth and mineral tones. Though certainly its own creature, this is reminiscent of Gamay or Pinot Noir.

title: Escudero Vidau 2008
raw_ec_shortdesc: Vivid ruby-red. Pungent cherry pit, red currant and cracked pepper scents, along with subtle vanilla and woodsmoke flourishes. Taut and penetrating on the palate, offering bitter cherry and red berry flavors underscored by a vein of juicy acidity. Delivers strong closing thrust, steadily building tannins and a touch of sweet chewing tobacco on the long, incisive finish. Drinking window: 2019-2025. Score - 91. (Josh Raynolds, vinous.com, Feb. 21, 2019)

title: The Tragically Hip Fifty Mission Cab Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon with a small amount of Merlot from two select vineyards in the Niagara Peninsula. Grapes were crushed and fermented in one tonne fermenter bins with daily manual punch-down of the caps. The wine was then racked into French oak barrels (30% new barrels, 40% 1 year old, 30 % seasoned) for 12 months prior to blending. Hip fans will be gobbling up these wines up quickly, but I hope they will take the time to enjoy the bottles rather than keep them as souvenirs. it really is a nice red wine to drink. It has a fairly robust nose of blackberries, dark cherries, dried tobacco, violets, plums and toasted oak spice notes. It's rich and smooth on the palate with ripe dark berries, a touch of cherry compote, cassis, Cuban tobacco and earthy notes with lovely integrated spice notes and mouth-watering acidity driving the back end. A really fine Cabernet with classic Niagara elegance and enough stuffing to cellar 5+ years, though attractive right now. Better hurry if you want any of this special wine. Go Leafs Go! Score - 92. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, Nov. 28, 2023)

title: Domaine Le Champs des Murailles La Petite Muraille 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This delicious wine, hailing from the Languedoc region of France, is a blend of 40% grenache noir, 30% carignan, 30% cinsault. It offers up a fascinating nose of cherry jam, strawberry, dried herbs, and mocha. Wonderfully juicy with smooth tannins and a medium body. Flavours of cherry and blackberry are prominent, with the blackberry lingering wonderfully in the finish. At this price, you are going to want more than one bottle. Pair with grilled ribs basted with a tangy bbq sauce. Score - 92. (Dave Isaacs, winecurrent.com, April 11, 2023)

title: Dominio del Bendito Las Sabias 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Tasted next to the 2017, the 2018 Las Sabias stole the show. It has ripeness, depth and complexity, and the palate feels very harmonious in the Titán XL style. It's still a baby that needs a little bit of time to polish its tannins, and it should develop for a long time in bottle. Drink date: 2022-2030. Score - 94. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, June 30, 2021)

title: Domaine de la Marinière Vieilles Vignes Chinon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Desbourdes family has farmed this site since 1965, and this old-vine Cabernet Franc comes from grapes averaging 60 years of age. It has the structure to pair with steak or chipotle portobello tacos.

title: Eastdell Gamay Noir 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Gamay Noir has become Niagara's best-kept secret. It's often overshadowed by its Burgundian counterpart, Pinot Noir. Pour alongside grilled tuna steaks and an arugula salad.

title: Courtois La Grange Vinsobres 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Pretty ruby color with purple reflection on the rim, this unoaked blend of grenache and syrah presents with beautiful red plum, strawberry, toasted bread and leather aromas. Lively on the palate with fresh acidity and more savoury character than anticipated, it showcases dry bay leaf and black olives flavours with a fruity note in the backdrop. Pleasant to drink on its own with its polished tannins and well-integrated alcohol, it's got a nice medium-full body to enjoy beside grilled meats on the barbecue or a hearty lentil and mushroom stew. Drink or cellar. Exceptional Value! Score - 92. (Louise Boutin, winecurrent.com, Jan. 8, 2024)

title: Errázuriz KAI Carmenère 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: There's a delicious briny quality to this wine hailing from a balanced vintage in which freshness and depth work in perfect counterpoint. Vibrant and characterful with smoked paprika, roasted peppers, wild oregano and rocket, piercing a deep layer of plum, fresh figs and black and green olives. Lovely perfumed notes (sandal, incense) play in the background. Beautiful, chiselled tannins. Long finish with lingering pink and white pepper, roasted coffee beans, fig leaf, and a zesty tail of pink grapefruit. Drinking window: 2024-2041. Score - 95. (Ines Salpico, decanter.com, April 26, 2024)

title: D.V. Catena Historic Red Blend 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Tinto Histórico DV Catena is a blend of 75% Malbec, 18% Bonarda and 7% Petit Verdot from Luján de Cuyo and the Uco Valley and was aged for eight months in new and used barrels. It's garnet red in the glass. The ripe, liqueur-like nose offers sour cherry and plum notes leavened by fresh herbal notes over a pleasant secondary layer from the aging process. Quite smooth with good volume, the flow is juicy yet a little compressed in the mouth. Drinking window: 2022-2033. Score - 92. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, Nov. 3, 2022)

title: Damjanic Borgonja 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Borgonja is the local name for Blaufränkisch. The wine is ruby red in colour, on the nose intense fruit aroma of currant and raspberry, violet flowers. On the pallet we have refreshing acidity and at the end red pepper and paprika. Overall, fruity taste with herbal notes of clove. Tannins are soft and the wine is very elegant and well balanced. Gastro recommendation: pasta with meat sauce, scrambled eggs with sausage. It blends elegantly with grilled sardines, black risotto, salami, prosciutto and medium-aged cheeses.

title: Mega Spileo Estate Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Mega Spileo Monastery has been used for worship and grape-growing since the fourth century CE, making it one of the oldest monasteries in the world and a cultural icon to Greece. The estate began producing modern wine thanks to the revitalization efforts of the Anastasiou brothers in 1999 and now produces high-quality wines made from Greek and international grapes.

title: Dios Ares Crianza 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2018 Ares Crianza is quite different from the one from the new project, Voelos, which is more traditional. This is still Tempranillo from the Sonsierra, matured in French barriques for 12 months but in a completely different style - here, the fruit takes the leading role. This is a super-drinkable style of Crianza, with the oak in the background (or even further back...) with clean fruit and a vibrant palate with great freshness. This is perfect by the glass and with food. Drink date: 2020-2024. Score - 91. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Oct. 30, 2020)

title: Enrico Serafino Sanavento Barbaresco 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 vintage was a challenging one for Piedmont, with frost and hail in the early months but a hot, dry summer, resulting in lower yields of intense concentration. Barbaresco and Barolo are already showing stunning prominence and excellent ageing potential along with their notes of sour cherry, Italian leather, tobacco and rosehip.

title: Domaine Mucyn Aquilon Cornas 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Profoundly ripe, spicy cassis on the nose and palate are accentuated by bold strikes of licorice, violet and bramble in this rich, complex Syrah. Moderately full in body, it's luscious but freshly balanced, held upright by a crisp acidic backbone and firm, gripping tannins. Delightful already, it will improve through 2035. Score - 95. (Anna Lee Iijima, Wine Enthusiast, July 1, 2020)

title: Domaine de la Solitude Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Very attractive nose of raspberries, licorice and oranges with a touch of summer flowers. Round and silky on the full-bodied palate, the ample tannins are beautifully integrated, making the long, refined finish velvety. A cuvee of 65% grenache, 20% syrah, and 5% each of mourvedre, counoise and cinsault from biodynamically grown grapes. Drink or hold. Score - 94. (Stuart Pigott, jamessuckling.com, May 3, 2024)

title: Creekside Iconoclast Syrah 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Three blocks contribute to Creekside's syrah and for those who have been paying attention the first four letters in this wine's name speak the cool truth. Add a terrific vintage for Bench reds out of Niagara on top of an already established view on what works well and where, well you are seeing the picture laid out bare, base and necessary. Iconoclast is a beacon of varietal excellence from 2020 with its fruit animosity and meaty glare. The co-conspiratorial symmetry and symbiosis make for a grand statement, a structured one at that and what may be the top drop seen. Tasted too. Drink 2023-2027. Tasted October 2022. Score - 92. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

raw_ec_shortdesc: It's said that the inventor of the stump-jump plough had poor eyesight and required regular vision testing, hence the eye exam chart on the label of this wine. title: Domaine Autrand Vinsobres 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The tank-matured 2022 Vinsobres is a blend of 60% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre. It looks like an overachiever at this stage, with bold cherries and raspberries on the nose, even a hint of stone fruit. Full-bodied, round and expansive, with a creamy-textured mid-palate, it moves seamlessly into a long, concentrated and tannic finish. Drink date: 2025-2035. Score - 93. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, May 16, 2024)

title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Juicy, well balanced, plenty of personality, with enough juice through the mid palate to balance out the big tannins that are pretty inescapable in any wines of ambition in 2020. The finish closes in sharply, but this is an enjoyable wine from the Lorenzetti-owned Lilian Ladouys (and for me one of the clear leaders of the new Cru Bourgeois Exceptionnel category). 35% new oak, harvest September 15 to 30, 78% first wine. Drinking window: 2026-2040. Score - 93. (Jane Anson, decanter.com, March 16, 2023)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Really sophisticated aromas of blackberries, plums, crushed stones, concrete, wet earth and fresh mushrooms. Complex is the word. title: Clos de Caveau Fruit Sauvage Vacqueyras 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Purity, freshness and aromatic precision - a promising start. Full-bodied, rounded, generous and fruity. Feels very Vacqueyras and has really punchy acidity to match the rich fruit. (Matt Walls, decanter.com, Dec. 15, 2022)

title: Col d'Orcia Brunello di Montalcino 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: 'Great expectations, here we go again,' said in the most positive of respects voice and while the Cinzano family may not think in hyperbole, for this vintage they most surely appreciate an opportunity to create what matters from the gifts of nature. Many producers will go low and some high but Col d'Orcia stays the estate heritage course to make sure both early generosity and more importantly aging structure is the long term plan. You feel the up front wholesomeness and then the length because the framework is everything and projections essential to understanding and appreciating this modal world. Fine wine so worthy of praises because we know it will impress in 2039. How could we doubt such a prognosis? Drink 2025-2039. Tasted November 2023. Score - 95. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

title: d'Arenberg The Dead Arm Shiraz 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Quite expressive and exotic, with red plums, blackberries and iodine, as well as dried herbs and nori, quite fragrant spices and currants. The palate has a sleek, dense and long feel, with impressive fruit intensity, delivered in such contained and impressively composed style. This has such length and intensity with a silky texture. Old vines underpin the style here. Drink over the next decade or more.  Score - 96. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 27, 2022)

title: Colio Reserve Merlot 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Colio's Reserve merlot from an exceptional vintage in Niagara-on-the-Lake features generous and appealing perfume. A lush and fleshy incarnation, texturally appealing and approachable with memorable juiciness. The tannins offer a light grip and add volume to the palate. Notes of raspberry and black plum with cocoa and tobacco lingering on the finish of very good length. An honest and noteworthy expression of the grape variety picked at the peak of ripeness. A much-improved bottle than first tasted in January. Re-tasted June 2022. Gold Medal winner with a combined rating of 92 points at the 2022 National Wine Awards of Canada. Score - 91. (Sara d'Amato, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Colio's Reserve merlot from an exceptional vintage in Niagara-on-the-Lake features generous and appealing perfume. title: Courtois La Source Côtes du Rhône 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A blend of 85% grenache and 15% syrah that was matured in stainless steel, this shows generous fruit in an easy-drinking style. The flavours are mostly in the red fruit zone with hints of spiciness, and they are wrapped around a core of fresh acidity. It's an attractive wine to sip on its own or to drink with food. Drinking window: now to 2026 to enjoy its freshness. (Tasted December 2023) Score - 90. (Rod Phillips)

title: Château Pape Clément 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Ranking with the top wines of the vintage, the dense purple-hued 2020 Château Pape Clement offers a sensational bouquet of pure crème de cassis interwoven with notes of liquid violets and classy oak. Possessing flawless balance, full-bodied richness, and ultra-fine tannins, it excels in this vintage and has a pretty, elegant, yet also layered and concentrated profile. It will drink well with just short-term cellaring yet evolve gracefully for 20-30 years. I was able to taste this on multiple occasions, and it always checked in near the upper end of the scale. This is a gorgeous wine in the making. Score - 97-99. (jebdunnuck.com, May 23, 2021)

title: Château Margaux 1995
raw_ec_shortdesc: This still broods seriously, with dark plum, currant and blackberry fruit, studded with charcoal, singed tobacco and cedar notes and backed by a serious grip of roasted earth. The gorgeously long finish is driven by old-school tannins, with the smoldering edge going on and on. A brick house of a Margaux, with more charcoal than graphite, more austerity than elegance and more power than refinement. - Non-blind Château Margaux vertical (December 2013). Drink now through 2034. Ranked #2 in Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 1998.  Score - 97. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, Nov. 30, 2014)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This still broods seriously, with dark plum, currant and blackberry fruit, studded with charcoal, singed tobacco and cedar notes and backed by a serious grip of roasted earth. The gorgeously long finish is driven by old-school tannins, with the smoldering edge going on and on. A brick house of a Margaux, with more charcoal than graphite, more austerity than elegance and more power than refinement. - Non-blind Château Margaux vertical (December 2013). Drink now through 2034. Ranked #2 in Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 1998.  Score - 97. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, Nov. 30, 2014)

title: Clos Dubreuil 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2015 Clos Dubreuil is a blend of 80% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon aged in 100% new French oak over the next 20 months. It has a delightful bouquet of hoisin and redcurrant, beautifully defined with an attractive marine influence coming through with aeration. The palate is medium-bodied with steely tannin, very focused with a brisk and vibrant finish that seems more precise than previous vintages, with a dash of white pepper on the aftertaste. This is serious Saint Emilion that is for long-term ageing. Bon vin! Drink date: 2021-2040. Score - 92-94. (Neal Martin, robertparker.com, April 27, 2016)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2015 Clos Dubreuil is a blend of 80% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon aged in 100% new French oak over the next 20 months. raw_ec_shortdesc: The ample fruitiness of this 80% Merlot wine is right up front. It comes from a large 116-acre estate on the extension of the Pomerol plateau. title: Château Breillan 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Château Breillan is a specialized 'teaching estate' for the Blanquefort viticulture and oenology school. This wine is Merlot and Cabernet Franc sourced from gravel and calcareous clay soils. It's broad and concentrated, with nicely outlined blackcurrant, dark fruit and oak spice and an attractive, easy-to-enjoy character. A real value at this price, it will be great with a winter stew.

title: Castello Romitorio Filo di Seta Brunello di Montalcino 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Resplendent with a thousand different colours this regal glass of Brunello alternates notes of lemon, face powder, sandalwood, white pepper, linden, rose petals, pink grapefruit and guaranà. In the background the notes of green tea leaves and peppermint give a notable freshness to the matrix. Medium bodied, perfectly mature tannins of a silky character and a very fine finale which exalts from the centre palate onwards to the dynamic, smooth closure. Better from 2024. [Will cellar into the 2040s.] Score - 97. (Raffaele Vecchione, winescritic.com, Oct. 19, 2022)

title: Château Musar Red 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2017 Château Musar has a perfumed bouquet with well-defined plummy red fruit, fireside embers and pressed flower scents. A hint of VA in the background gives the aromatics a welcome kick. The palate is medium-bodied with fine tannins and well-judged acidity, harmonious, not powerful, yet full of flavor. A pleasing bitterness surfaces towards the finish, with moderate persistence and a residual white pepper tang lingering in the mouth. Very nice. Drinking window: 2023-2040. Score - 90. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, April 3, 2023)

title: Casa Silva Gran Terroir de Los Andes Los Lingues Carmenère 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: 100% Carmenère. The search for Chile's distinguished sites and terroirs continues apace. One sign of this is the way in which the scrutiny of larger zones (like Colchagua) is now falling on sub-regional appellations (like the higher-altitude Los Lingues, with its Andean mountain influences). If this Los Lingues Carmenère from is anything to go by, excitements await. The wine is an opaque purple-black in colour, with exciting, zesty aromas of pounded fruits and freshly cut flowers. In the mouth, it's smooth yet ample in volume, almost seamless and remarkably harmonious for such a young wine. The flavours are fruit-led, with ample soft plum and blueberry charm, yet that floral aromatic refinement persists in the mouth and lends the fruits complexity and grace. Ultra-soft tannins and gentle, almost sweetly fruity acidity (an acidity which barely seems acid) complete the beguiling picture. Best in Show. Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2023)

title: Cellier des Dauphins Réserve Côtes du Rhône 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A generous Cotes du Rhone with stacks of blackberry and red berry fruit plus a touch of licorice. The ample soft tannins on the full-bodied palate give this an attractively velvety mouthfeel, then comes a blast of blueberry at the generous, but moderately dry finish. A cuvee of 60% grenache and 40% syrah. Drink now [or hold until 2028]. Score - 90. (Stuart Pigott, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 1, 2024)

title: Cave du Château de Chénas Coeur de Granit 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Made from grapes grown in granitic soils and aged in stainless-steel tanks to preserve fruit intensity and freshness, this supple Gamay offers aromas of pomegranate, peony seeds, cardamom, and a hint of bubble gum. (Concours International du Gamay, 2023)

title: Calcu Tiny Blocks Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The granitic soils of Marchigüe in western Colchagua usually provide firm tannins that can often only be tamed with a few years in the bottle. And those palate-prickling tannins are strongly felt here in this cabernet from vineyards planted in 2007, although fortunately, there's more to it than that. Ripe red fruits and herbal touches unfurl gracefully in a wine that would go very well with game meat. This red was aged for 12 months in barrels. [A wine with the potential to see 2030+.] Score - 92. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2023)

title: Campet Saint Marie Vieilles Vignes Saint-Chinian 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine is named for the small undulating hillside vineyards in the foothills of the Massif Central. The Grenache and Syrah here were harvested and fermented separately. The result is a ripe, concentrated wine with black and red fruit, oak spice and garrigue. A great option for beef or vegetarian lentil stew.[Berliner Wein Trophy did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Berliner Wein Trophy, 2023)

title: Bussola Vigneto Alto TB Riserva Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2011
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2011 Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Riserva TB takes its time opening up in theglass, emerging with rich black cherries offset by sour citrus. Over time, its fruit evolves more toward tart raspberry with holiday spices, brown sugar and incense. The textures are like weighty crushed velvet, slowly draped across the palate, leaving ripe black fruits and notes of chocolate, with sweet violet pastille and hints of roasted almond that last well into the finish. Round tannins linger but don't get in the way of this deeply seductive and perfectly balanced expression. A few years of cellaring should unveil further aromatic depths that will heighten the experience, yet this is already pure pleasure in a glass. Drinking window: 2023-2036. Score - 95. (Eric Guido, vinous.com, Feb. 2021)

title: Calamus Ball's Falls Red
raw_ec_shortdesc: Alluring aromas of rich, dark berry fruit, dark chocolate and cassis abound on the nose of this deftly balanced, gorgeously flavoured red. It dishes up mouthfuls of sweet-tinged fruit - dark cherry and ripe bramble berry interwoven with excellent tang and acidity and mixed spice. It's medium bodied with good mouthfeel and a lengthy finish oozing with flavour, tangy acidity and plenty of charm. Load up the trunk and pour with steak, burgers or beef fajitas. Drink or cellar. Exceptional Value!  Score - 91. (Vic Harradine, winecurrent.com, Feb. 20, 2023)

title: By Farr Farrside Pinot Noir 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Farrside vineyard is a northeast-facing slope consisting of limestone topped with black volcanic soil. This sees about 60% new oak for 18 months. Superbly complex and lifted aromatically. Green pea, bramble, savoury spice, game meat and rhubarb, freshened by macerated strawberry. A broody palate nevertheless with lovely lift and glide and a cooling mineral feel. Cherry, earth, and forest floor are wrapped up in tangy acid and fine, persistent tannins to an earthy close. At once elegant and brooding. A brilliant wine. Drinking window: 2026-2031. Score - 95. (Tom Kline, decanter.com, April 27, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Farrside vineyard is a northeast-facing slope consisting of limestone topped with black volcanic soil. This sees about 60% new oak for 18 months. title: Bordón Gran Reserva 2013
raw_ec_shortdesc: If you like classical Rioja, this gran reserva may make you smile. Fully mature, it isn't a wine to keep but to enjoy over the coming year or two for its nuanced flavors that touch on blue fruit, yellow nectarines and green shishito peppers. The texture is rich and lively, a friendly Rioja that gains gravity and length with a day of air.  Score - 92. (wineandspiritsmagazine.com, Feb. 2023)

title: Ca' Romé Romano Marengo Cerretta Barolo 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2017 Barolo Cerretta is a dark, mysterious wine. Black cherry, lavender, sage, mint and licorice bring out a darker, more muscular side of Nebbiolo. Firm, driving tannins add to an impression of gravitas and power. Even with all of its tannic clout, the Cerretta is endowed with terrific balance and class. This is impressive. Drinking window: 2025-2037. Score - 95. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Feb. 2021)

title: Boschendal 1685 Pinotage 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Boschendal is the second-oldest estate in South Africa, and the '1685' on the label refers to the year of the original title deeds for these estate lands. This take on South Africa's classic grape is ripe and rich, with buoyant red fruit, currants, baking spice and tobacco. Drink now through 2026+.

title: Beni di Batasiolo Nebbiolo 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Piedmont's lofty reputation as one of the world's most prized wine regions is founded upon Nebbiolo. The grape is responsible for two of Italy's greatest wines (Barolo and Barbaresco) and stands alongside only Pinot Noir for its ability to express terroir. Nebbiolo wines from Langhe offer amazing value. Look for raspberry, dried herbs, apple, earth and light oak tones in this wine.

title: Barbanera Special Selection Da Uve Leggermente Appassite 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine was fermented using partially dried grapes. Drying prior to fermentation concentrates sugars and flavour components within the grape, imparting additional colour, flavour and body to the final wine. This example will offer intense red and black cherry framed by vanilla and sweet spices, with a smooth, silky mouthfeel. Perfect for roasted meats or hearty winter stews.[Luca Maroni tasting note not available.] Score - 97. (lucamaroni.com, Jan. 19, 2023)

title: Bachelder Les Villages Gamay Noir 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Villages Gamay is a blend of east and west vineyards including lots from Wismer-Foxcroft, Bai Xu, Bator, Willms and now Wiley, the new terroir in the family on the Short Hills Bench. 'It blends the juicy stuff from NOTL with more structure from the Bench,' said Bachelder. It has a lovely floral note on the nose with a melange of juicy red berries, plums, and integrated spice notes. It's mouth-filling and fruit-laden with smooth tannins, subtle meatiness, black raspberries, dark cherries, anise, spice, and a tangy, bright finish. It's drinking fine now but can cellar a few years. [Drink until 2026.] Score - 91. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, May 1, 2023)

title: Bertani Catullo Valpolicella Ripasso Classico Superiore 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: An atypically light colour for Ripasso, aged in large format French wood following fermentation on pomace of Amarone Classico for one month. This is excellent. There is little to bring awareness to dried fruit characteristics, such is the purity and transparency. A wine of verve, fecund strawberry flavors, a lilt of bergamot and deft levels of concentration. Yet so light on its feet as it pirouettes through the mouth with a mineral twirl and a saline spurt across the long finish. An easy substitute for a quality Burgundy. Drink or hold. Score - 95. (Ned Goodwin, MW, jamessuckling.com, May 9, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: An atypically light colour for Ripasso, aged in large format French wood following fermentation on pomace of Amarone Classico for one month. This is excellent. There is little to bring awareness to dried fruit characteristics, such is the purity and transparency. A wine of verve, fecund strawberry flavors, a lilt of bergamot and deft levels of concentration. title: Avondale Qvevri 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: In 2018 Avondale's Johnathan Grieve poured test tube samples drawn from Qvevri and now in 2022 the third iteration really begins to show his in depth understanding of the process. Red is a Rhône blend, grenache driven, with mourvèdre and syrah under a submerged cap, 60 per cent whole bunch, carbonic maceration and spontaneous fermentation. Heads through punchdown and is left on skins post ferment for 30-60 days, depending on the Qvevri. It's almost Beaujolais style albeit with longer Piedmontese-esque soaks. The goal and credible arrival at fruition is more tannin by skins in extraction, earthiness from the clay but bright fruit all in. The tannins are chalky chewy and overall the wine remains really bright and effusive. Please serve this chilled. Drink 2023-2026. Tasted October 2022. Score - 91. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: In 2018 Avondale's Johnathan Grieve poured test tube samples drawn from Qvevri and now in 2022 the third iteration really begins to show his in depth understanding of the process. Heads through punchdown and is left on skins post ferment for 30-60 days, depending on the Qvevri. It's almost Beaujolais style albeit with longer Piedmontese-esque soaks. raw_ec_shortdesc: The Mavro Kalavritino and Cabernet Sauvignon grapes are grown in the mountainous Corinthian Gulf region of the Peloponnese. title: Baettig Vino de Viñedo Los Compadres Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2022 Cabernet Sauvignon Los Compadres originates from Cauquenes in the southern Maule Region. With a garnet red hue and a purplish sheen, it presents aromas of cassis and sour cherry, complemented by minty notes, hints of cigar ash and a touch of cedar in the background. Dry, taut and juicy on the palate, it boasts a light structure and fine-grained tannins that culminate in a compact and flavorful finish. This balanced Cabernet exhibits a precise harvest point, which prevents the overly clingy mouthfeel often associated with Chilean Cabernet. Drinking window: 2024-2036. Score - 95. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, July 3, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2022 Cabernet Sauvignon Los Compadres originates from Cauquenes in the southern Maule Region. title: Adamo Estate Parke Vineyard Grower's Series Pinot Noir 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Adamo is an ambitious project in the Hockley Valley (actually on a hilltop) near Orangeville, and as their own vines mature winemaker Shauna White is sourcing from prime sites in Niagara, like the Parke Vineyard on Twenty Mile Bench. This pours pale garnet. The nose is nicely lifted and complex with wood smoke curling around classic sour cherry, cinnamon and vanillin. It's light to mid-weight, very smooth with very refined tannin. There is a tart and sour streak with lurking volatility but it squeaks under my normally low bar, and flavour intensity and length are excellent. Well priced for premium Niagara pinot. Drink now to 2025. Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Adamo is an ambitious project in the Hockley Valley (actually on a hilltop) near Orangeville, and as their own vines mature winemaker Shauna White is sourcing from prime sites in Niagara, like the Parke Vineyard on Twenty Mile Bench. title: Tagaro Mancinello Nero di Troia 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sweet spices and some dried fruit to the nose. Cloves, smoked herbs and vanilla, too. Tight and creamy tannins give structure to the medium- to full-bodied palate before a juicy, berry-fruit finish. Nicely drinkable. Drink or hold. Score - 92. title: Monsaraz Reserva 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a young wine that needs a little more time to discover its mature character. A blend of alicante bouschet, touriga nacional, and trincadeira, it shows a flavour profile heavily weighted toward dark fruit and with very good complexity and breadth. The fruit-acid balance is excellent, and the tannins are drying without being too intrusive. Given time for the components to integrate, this will be a very attractive wine. Score - 93. (Rod Phillips, 2023)

title: Col d'Orcia Poggio al Vento Riserva Brunello di Montalcino (Magnum) 2004
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2004 Brunello di Montalcino Riserva Poggio al Vento is developing beautifully. This is a decidedly feminine, graceful style of Poggio al Vento. The wine literally floats on the palate with gracious layers of fruit. Silky tannins support sweet red berries, flowers and spices on the mouthwatering finish. The 2004 is flat-out beautiful. This was a relatively generous harvest, and that comes through in the wine's medium-bodied structure.Drinking window: 2014-2044. Score - 95+. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, May 2012)
